The rest is yours, as are these rules—you can do whatever you want with them (including selling your own adventures) so long as you give attribution.

157104.name: Steam Gunboat
157104.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is a basic TL4 steam powered gunboat.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

157105.name: Hard Suits, Combat Walkers and Battlesuits
157105.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new supplement for 2300AD expands the roles of combat walkers, hard suits and battlesuits, introducing new designs ready to take to the stars. Battlesuits are clam-shell-style unpowered armour (sometimes with assistive exoskeletons), while hard suits are humanoid suits of powered combat armour with enhanced capabilities. Combat walkers are the large but lightweight, non-humanoid walking vehicles.

Also included is a complete and expanded design system for all three, allowing referees and players to create their own designs, from basic utility models to hardened battle machines dedicated to annihilating the growing menaces Mankind is discovering on the far reaches of the exploratory Arms.

157106.name: S.R.D. of the All Mind
157106.description:
website blurb:
S.R.D. of the All Mind is applicable 3rd edition rules to run characters from the SYSTEM REFERENCE DOCUMENT Revised (v.3.5). “Skills” passages have been excised that are supplanted by Knights of the All Mind. The four booklets of S.R.D. of the All Mind combined with Knights of the All Mind contain the substantive rules needed for players.

Volume 1, Adventurous Men, has information on races and classes for building a character. No offense intended to women, “men” is just a tongue-in-cheek nod to gender stereotypes of 70′s gaming. Volume 2 of S.R.D. of the All Mind, Travels and Gear, has information on movement, weapons, armor, and adventuring equipment. Clashes and Feats, the 3rd volume, contains rules for combat plus all the relevant feats from the System Reference Document. The 4th and final volume of S.R.D. of the All Mind, Magical Incantations, details the pertinent rules from the System Reference Document for casting arcane and divine magic spells. Note that there are only general spell descriptions by class for each spell.

user summary:
This 4 volume set of booklets, in combination with the Knights of the All Mind booklet, form the core rules for the Knights of the All Mind rpg.

157107.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Take your game on the go, with the Legendary Game Board Play mat! This portable rubber play mat makes for easy storage and transport! Prepare your Heroes for the dangerous fights ahead and gear up to thwart the villainous Mastermind with this Legendary Game Board Play mat! Order yours today and rise to the legends that your Heroes were made to fulfill and the glory that you were destined to achieve!
boardgameaccessory: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
157107.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Playmat

157109.name: Lune Class Freelancer
157109.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lune is a multirole ship designed with small groups in mind such as freelancers, agents and adventurers. With decent armour, weapons and engines, she can fulfil a number of roles.

Contains:

A description and guided tour of the vessel
Details of 6 notable ships of the class
3 versions of the Lune with complete deckplans, specifi cation and game sheets
The Gillow Class launch with one variant with deckplans and specifi cations
An example crew with complete game stats
New equipment




Included as seperate files are A3 sized, technical blueprints, deckplan (bluerpint style) and 15mm scale black and white plans on A3 size sheets

This book is for the Mongoose edition of Traveller and set in the Third Imperium, although it could fit in just about any other setting.

157110.name: Vehicle Book: Navarro UTE
157110.description:
From publisher blurb:

Besides spacecraft the next big piece of kit players may need is a vehicle. The ship will get you to the world, but a vehicle will get you from the spaceport to where you are going.

This book details one such vehicle the Navarro UTE or Navarro Utility. It’s a useful and simple vehicle, players and referees alike may find useful.

Included are:

7 versions of the Navarro (plus a few extra variants for some of them)
Game specifications
Colour plates,
Adventure hooks (including the stats for a particularly nasty predator),
A new vehicle design modification
Complete game sheet for all seven versions of the Navarro, which are:
Horden Navarro UTE-W (Utility Vehicle Wheeled)
Horden Navarro UTE-WT (Utility Vehicle Wheeled Twin Cab)
Horden Navarro UTE-T (Utility Vehicle Tracked)
Horden Navarro UTE-H (Utility Vehicle Hover)
Horden Navarro UTE-G (Utility Vehicle Grav)
Horden Navarro UTE-WX (Utility Vehicle Advanced Wheeled)
Horden Navarro UTE-W Custom ‘The Buggurup’





Suitable for the the Mongoose Core Traveller Rules and uses Vehicle handbook.
Designed to fit in just about any setting.

157111.name: Pukharra Fast Scout
157111.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ship Book: Pukharra Fast Scout is a supplement to the Mongoose Traveller system which details a 100-ton scout ship. Designed to go fast, this is an ideal vessel for players and NPCs alike.

Although this is designed for the 3rd Imperium setting, it could easily fit in any other.

Features:

Detailed description of the layour of the Pukharra
Game stats for the ship and the Grandjagoo sealed air raft
5 pages of deckplans
A complete crew

157112.name: Ship Record Sheets
157112.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the key components of most Traveller games is the ship, this book is designed to record all a ships details and hopefully make running a ship easier for the players and referee alike.

Inside there are two versions of the same sheet that has room for most, if not all the details and features of any vessel.

Also included is a crew roster and small craft sheet.

4 Sample vessels are included with record sheets and specifications.

Typhonus Class Escort
Pukharra Fast Scout Stealth Variant
Type RAX Protected Merchant
Elson Class Explorer Vessel




Also included is a seperate fillable PDF file.

157113.name: Ronda
157113.description:
Objective: Gain as much money as possible
- acting by turns -
Players determine a wager; active player throws 2 dice:
On a board - numbered from 3 - 11 (7 in the centre) you have to pay money if the appropiate space/number is empty - collect money - if not. If you throw a 7 you have to pay anyway.
Throwing a 2 you collect all the money without '7', a '12' let you take all.
note: published before WWII

157114.name: Replicate
157114.description:
After scanning many galaxies, many stars, and many planets, you have arrived and found the perfect host to take over humanity. However, you are not the only one. Your probe must compete against others to release virus and take over your host.

Players take on the role of an alien species, controlling a probe that moves around a human's body and releases virus. But, the virus must overcome the body's natural defenses as well as competing for dominance with the other viruses.

Probes arrive in any of the six origin spaces and begin to take over the host's body. As the body's defenses break down, taking over becomes easier until it is taken over completely. The virus that takes over enough body parts, wins the game.

Players must manage a hand of cards, a board position with its virion pieces, and a probe that requires actions to use. Cards synergize well with each other when used in the right configuration and can allow a player to maximize advantages. Also, cards have a different effect when used against the body and when used against other viruses.

157118.name: Summerford
157118.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grown fat and wealthy on the trade flowing along the Mauro River, Summerford is a prosperous place. River barges laden with trade goods put into the docks and the local trading post is a veritable hive of activity. The village streets are clean and Lord Fabius Ocrtooth’s guards keep the populace safe. At night, the taproom of the Rusty Rapier is busy with peasants and traders alike relaxing after a hard day’s work. Turmoil and strife, though, lurk beneath Summerford’s placid exterior. Marauding kobolds repeatedly attack the nearby Iron Hill mine slaying the miners while in the village proper the widows of the slain miners call with increasing anger for the mine to be closed. Rumours of devil worship swirl about the village’s reclusive lord and a nascent gray market has established itself on the docks. Summerford is far from the tranquil idyll it seems.

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

157119.name: NorthCoast Roleplaying (Issue 9 - 1989)
rpgissueversion: Gaming from Behind the Redwood Curtain!
157119.description:
Weapons of the Future by Richard Leduc (Aftermath, Twilight: 2000, Palladium)
A Darker Shade of Grey by Jerod Aweeka and Chris Mah. For Beginning to Intermediate characters in Chaosium's Call of Cthulhu. Maps by Tom Hayes
The Leptrods: An alien race gby Gideon Marcus
Low Passage: DENEB Containerized Cargo Freighter by John D Law-Green
Sword of Lepardus: A new weapon for Fantasy Games by Ray Crowell
A NEW F.A.C.E.: A solo net scenario for Cyberpunk by Craig Sheeley

157120.name: Riverburg
157120.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Darkclaw Forest, amid the sluggish waters of the Greater Gurden River, stands the village of Riverburg. Set upon thick stilts driven deep into the riverbed, the village sprawls across several stout wooden platforms and serves as a sanctuary for those daring the surrounding forest or searching for the nearby Moaning Caves. A friendly, if isolated place, the village is home to the Rivermen's Guild who protect travellers from the depredations of vicious river pirates lurking somewhere in the nearby woodland.

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

157122.name: Walls
157122.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic? Then Dungeon Dressing is for you!
Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars, or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting, cool, noteworthy features.
This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane contents to add to the walls in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Walls is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury! Dungeon Dressing: Walls presents:

One table (100 entries) providing detailed descriptions of a wall’s characteristics.
One table (100 entries) presenting additional features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
Three clever well-based traps.

157123.name: Ceilings
157123.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of dungeons lacking in verisimilitude? Want to add cool little features of interest to your creations but don't have the time to come up with nonessential details? Want to make your dungeons feel more realistic? Then Dungeon Dressing is for you!
Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common dungeon fixture such as stairs, pillars, or pools and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting, cool, noteworthy features.
This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great mundane contents to add to the ceilings in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Ceilings is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!
Dungeon Dressing: Ceilings presents:

General information about dungeon ceilings.
One table presenting additional floor features such as hidden compartments, fungal growths, discarded equipment and more!
One table providing detailed descriptions of a floor’s characteristics.
Three clever ceiling-based traps (CRs 2-8).

157124.name: Ringwurfspiel "Treff sicher!"
157124.description:
Simple indoor ring toss game
- acting by turns -

Players choose a colour and throw plastic rings, hoping to catch one fn the targets and score some points.

The one who scores the most points after a pre-determined time limit runs out, wins.

Note:
Published before WWII

157125.name: Knights of the All Mind
157125.description:
from the Forward:
The Knights of the All Mind booklet is a rules-tincture collection in main distilled from a 70's and 80's role playing experience. Categorical selections herein are intended for those who wish to supplant difficulty checks for skills, as are common to 21st century versions of The World's Most Popular Role Playing Game, with old school ability checks similar to the 1st edition of that game. It is envisioned consumers of this work will preserve practical use of the more modern versions' other idiosyncrasies.

user summary:
This is meant to be used in conjunction with the S.R.D. of the All Mind.

157126.description:
Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game – Foul Play, an expansion for Blood Bowl: Team Manager, introduces the Putrid Players' Guild to the game, with the PPG consisting of three new teams: Nurgle's Rotters, The Lowdown Rats, and The Zharr-Naggrund Ziggurats.

Foul Play also introduces penalties to the game, with players receiving them in various ways, such as by drawing one of the new cheating tokens with the penalty icon or by losing the new Goblin Tribal Leeg tournament.

Finally, Foul Play introduces stadiums, which are constant throughout a season, offer additional payouts to teams, and come with strict rules about who can play in them. A stadium might ban a certain skill, for example, limit the number of players a manager can use, or impose upper or lower limits to Star Power requirements.
157126.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game – Foul Play
boardgameexpansion: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 2: Last Night On Earth, Lost Boys, and Galaxy Trucker
Planeta de Juegos 17 - Especial Stefan Feld
The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

157128.name: Blackmail
157128.description:
subtitle:
essential gamemastering information

from the introduction:
Blackmail details System Reference Document v.3.5 set & setting rules for game judges. This booklet is also adjusted to incorporate the 1e racial & class abilities in lieu of “skills” & “skill checks” from 3e. With the four S.R.D. of the All Mind booklets plus Words of Spells and Blackmail a judge has all the mechanical rules needed (otherwise found in a 3e version) to use the Knights of the All Mind supplement.

157129.name: Words of Spells
157129.description:
subtitle:
fantastic theurgical rules

website blurb:
Words of Spells is a spell book with the complete spell mechanics based on the System Reference Document. Alterations are only editing for brevity & making adjustments where certain spells influenced “skills” or “skill checks.” When necessary for effects involving “skills” either a 1e-flavored solution was recorded or the effect was merely excised.

157130.name: Manual de objets enchantes
157130.description:
subtitle:
a compendium of magical items

website blurb:
The Manual of Enchanted Objects provides a magic items resource from the System Reference Document Revised (v.3.5). As are the other booklets in this series, adjustments have been made to permit 1e abilities in place of 3e skills & skill checks.

157131.name: Prestige Klassen
157131.description:
website blurb:
Prestige Classes provide new abilities and the capability to use existing abilities in creative ways to customize your character. Choose wisely to transform your hero into entirely new levels of versatility!

157133.name: The Inheritance
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157133.description:
From publisher blurb:

Family friend, and great adventurer Gildas Trahern is dead. The journey to Caer Brennau to attend his funeral was pleasant enough and uneventful, but who could have predicted what would happen next? Raiding goblins, and thieving kobolds are just the beginning, but when the dragon Galversharn attacks it becomes a race against time to return what was stolen before Caer Brennau is razed to it's foundations and every last man, woman and child killed in draconic wrath!

To save Caer Brennau will take courage, fortitude and wisdom. The path will be long and fraught with much peril. Can a party of strangers work together long enough to complete the tasks before them? Is any inheritance worth all this?

157134.name: Kanzume Goddess: Thor, God of Thunder
157134.description:
Promo god for Kanzume Goddess.

Thor is a Norse god, with the War Drum and Smash abilities that enable you to pay energy to gain benefits during an attack or the discard phase.

157135.description:
Destination: Neptune shows an optimistic vision of commercial space exploration in the next century. Players control an organization with the resources and intent to explore, develop, and colonize the worlds beyond Earth. Organizations that practice careful planning and resource management, with a healthy dose of technology research will succeed. Destination: Neptune moves through four generations of space exploration. Players earn Victory Points by building large commercial outposts and colonies, as well as from fame and outright purchases. After four generations, the player with the most Victory Points wins the game.

This is a card driven game in which most Cards have an action that happens immediately, and another action for all of the players (including the player who played the card). Players can also sell cards in exchange for currency. When you sell a card, it goes to an Opportunity Track and is placed to the side of the board. If the Opportunity Track already has as many cards as players, the rightmost card is discarded. You may not change the order of the cards in the Opportunity Track. Players can play cards from the Opportunity Track as if they were in their hands.

Players must use the cards to gain currency and fuel in order to launch space missions to establish bases, factories and colonies on various locations within our solar system. Careful hand and resource management is key to winning the game. In addition, players also need to research certain technologies in order to build on most locations. Technologies are researched through card play and paying currency. The cards are separated into 4 piles which are separate generations. At the end of each generation, each player scores points for the various structures they've built. The game ends when all generation piles have been exhausted.
157135.name: Destination: Neptune
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 9 - Craig Cillessen & Clockwork Wars Review

157136.name: Primeval Evolution
157136.description:
Publisher Blurb:

More time travelling, more conspiracies, more danger.

It’s Primeval…evolved.

The ARC has been gutted, with the core of the team dead or lost in time. Now, under new leadership and with the aid of the shadowy Prospero Industries, it must rebuild, for the stakes are higher than ever.

Primeval Evolution expands your game by introducing the climactic events of Series 4 and 5, adding more options and adventures for your team to face. From the dangers posed by the artificial anomaly, the New Dawn Prototype, to getting lost in time or fighting carnivorous future beetles, you’re going to need to be sharper than ever to survive this time.

This 164-page softcover book contains:

- A complete guide for Series 4 and 5, including all the webisodes.
- Ideas for running campaigns set during Series 4 and 5.
- New technology, including the HMS Gartside, new locations and new threats.
- New non-ARC campaign frameworks, including For Queen and Country and the Time Tribe.
- Rules for characters lost in time and space, temporal damage and new rules for Anomalies.
- Three new adventures.

157137.name: Intrigue in the Royal Court
157137.description:
Each player represents a royal family that is attempting to influence the King or the Queen of an Ancient Kingdom in order to gain the royal favor that will make you become the next most powerfull family in the land.

In order to achieve the goal the players will have 10 (Ten) Archetypes they will use to surround the Royal Consort of their color with as much influence as possible.

The player who uses with cunning the resources at his/her disposal will be the winner.


SETUP

Each player will place his/her 10 tiles with the ACTIVE (This is the side with the banner) side up in his/her Activation Zone (Area close to the player where all the archetypes will enter play or return from play)

Place the king and the queen in the middle ground between the players in the same row with 2 spaces between them.

The game will be played in an imaginary grid with each space the size of one tile.

GAMEPLAY

Flip a coin, roll a die, find your method of convenience to choose a first player.

The game will be played in turns one player at a time. On your turn you must do the following actions:

1) PLAY A TILE from your Activation Area.

The first tile played by each player WILL NOT ACTIVATE ITS ABILITY. So it is very important you choose well which of your archetypes wont be used in the beginning of the game.

A tile played must always be adjacent to another tile (even diagonally) So you cannot place a tile anywhere in the imaginary grid.

A tile played always enters the game on the side it was in the Activation Area. So if the tile played was ACTIVE it stays with the side of the banner up and if the tile was INACTIVE it stays with the side that has a token drawn.

Consider INACTIVE tiles as protected from abilities when they are in PLAY since abilities cannot target INACTIVE tiles. It´s a very good strategy to keep this in mind because an opponent won´t be able to affect one of your INACTIVE tiles.

2) ACTIVE its ability (if possible)

Tiles that have been affected by an ability are turned to the INACTIVE SIDE (the one with the token on it). Same happens with the King and Queen.

Abilities cannot affect tiles that are in play with the INACTIVE SIDE up. This means that once a tile has been turned to the INACTIVE SIDE it´s safe on the board. It can be moved as usual by its owner but will not altered by an opponent.


3) MOVE ONE OF YOUR TILES IN PLAY ONE SPACE (diagonally or perpendicularly)

Notice that the joker has a special ability that allows you to move ONE MORE TIME after you placed it. This is a very strategical ability that can make big difference when you are trying to reposition a high influence tile on your turn or when you want to remove an opponent tile as well. Under no circumstance a tile can end up or move over another tile in the table.

When you move a tile it must always end adjacent to another tile. So you cannot move it on empty space unless it ended there due to the movement of the other tiles.


END GAME & WINNING CONDITIONS

The game will end when one of this two conditions happen:

1) One player starts his/her turn with his target consort surrounded by his own tiles (perpendicularly).

The victory is total. The more you play the less this condition is going to happen.

2) The players have played all of their tiles.

Once the players have played all of their tiles comes the scoring. For this step only the tiles that surround PERSPERNDICULARLY (up, down and sides) each royal consort will count. Add all the influence numbers in the tiles, PLUS all the tokens if there are INACTIVE tiles among them (each one is worth 1 point) MINUS the total influence on the tiles your opponent has surrounding your royal consort. Compare this numbers... the player with the most influence WINS the game. In case of a tie... you are both too smart to outwit each other :)


COMPONENTS

20 double sided tiles
1 king
1 queen

157138.name: The World's Smallest Dungeon
157138.description:
The World's Smallest Dungeon is "an adventure for one first-level character." It is a scenario that is SRD compatible and OGL compliant.

From the back of the booklet:

This fully playable adventure, suitable for a first level character of any race or class, is a perfect introduction for new players.

Containing two encounters and a full sized map suitable for use with miniatures, it can be played in less than a half hour.

So, cough up a dollar, grab some dice, and get read to enter...

The booklet does have a listed MSRP of $1.00 and is only 6 pages long.

157139.description:
Your Minions serve you without question. You are their Gawd. Their souls feed you in your quest toward the power to realize XHAOS THEORY. As you carefully wager their souls in bloody battles against other Gawds you risk losing those precious souls. A Gawd without worship ceases to exist.
Command and guide your minions carefully or all hope is lost.

Xhaos Theory is for those that have always asked “What if?” Young and old, experienced or not. Play with a massive miniature collection, or just a handful of models or toys.

Xhaos Theory allows you to create virtually any miniature unit you want, from any time frame, and fantasy or Sci-Fi book you have ever read and take that force up against another player that has created their own force. That force could be a one miniature force of a giant city eating lizard, or a squad of super heroes, or perhaps a legion of undead! Scenarios, settings, number of models? That's all up to you!

Xhaos Theory is a scalable miniature wargame allowing players total control over size and setting. You can play a full out large scale battle, or a small skirmish with Xhaos Theory. Many battles have been fought with 7 miniatures on one side, and 20+ on the other.

Xhaos Theory is a turn based miniature war game simplified for younger gamers also for quick play. Complete customization of your own army and campaign system to advance your army.
157139.name: Xhaos Theory: The Miniature Game

157140.name: Epoch (1981)
157140.description:
User Summary

Jump into your space fighter and shoot down the enemy spaceships in this early Star Raiders clone.

157141.name: The Dungeon Dozen
157141.description:
subtitle:
Random Tables for Fantasy RPGs

website blurb:

An idea book for tabletop fantasy role-playing games collecting over 200 inspirational random tables for the still-neglected d12. What's in the giant's lunchbox? Why is there an Underworld? Why are the humanoids acting weird today? These are some of the questions posed and answered in this volume. The Dungeon Dozen is loaded to the gills with black and white dungeon art by Chris Brandt, John Larrey, Stefan Poag, and Jason Sholtis.




designer's comments:

Available in hardcover and paperback editions
222 pages
200+ random tables (primarily from the first year or so of this blog)
Chock full of black and white dungeon illustrations by Chris Brandt, John Larrey, Stefan Poag and myself
TWO, count 'em, TWO indices for your convenience

157142.name: Cyclades
157142.description:
Players must buy the favor of the gods in their race to be the first player to build two cities in the Ancient Greek island group known as the Cyclades.

Victory requires respect for all the gods - players cannot afford to sacrifice to only one god, but must pay homage to each of five gods in turn. Each turn, the players bid for the favors of the gods, as only one player can have the favor of each god per turn - and each player is also limited to the favor of a single god per turn.

Ares allows the movement of player armies and the building of Fortresses.
Poseidon allows players to move their navies and build Ports.
Zeus allows his followers to hire priests and build temples.
Athena provides her worshipers with philosophers and universities.
Apollo increases the income of his worshipers.

Source: BoardGameGeek.

157143.name: Shifty Partners
157143.description:
Shifty Partners is a partnership trick-taking standard deck playing card game, with randomly-selected trumps. Partnerships change with each hand, and scoring is by individual. Trumps change with each hand, determined by a d6 die-roll.

The object of the game is to have the most points at the end of the game. The game ends after each player has dealt one hand. During the game, each player will be partnered with every other player. Partnership designations shift after each hand. A unique feature is that the dealer is always a partner with the player on his right.

A partial deck is used, with the number of cards determined by the number of players. Five cards are dealt to each player, with one being face-up. Only four tricks are played in each hand.

Each trick captured counts 1 point, and each Queen and Deuce counts 1 point. Each member of a partnership scores the total points caught by the entire partnership.

157144.name: Spielwerk: Das Spielemagazin des A.S.H. e.V. (Issue 3 - Oct 2004)
rpgissue: Spielwerk: Das Spielemagazin des A.S.H. e.V.
157144.description:
User summary
This free issue for SPIEL (Essen 2004) includes scenarios for Grimm and LodlanD, missions for Warmachine and Memoir 44 (wargames/ skirmish?), variant rules for Piraten der Spanischen Meere, a divination system/ oracle and universal/generic location (herb store), a dark future short story, article about the changes from the old to the new World of Darkness, and an essay on the Vampire CCG (Renegade Garov).

157145.name: Der Weg zum Igelhaus
157145.description:
Objective:
be the first reaching space 90 - simple 'Roll&Move'-game.
Each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a marked/larger space follow instructions.

note:
cute drawings on a 23" x 15.3" map,
likely published 1950's

157146.name: Mythic Creatures of the Nile
157146.description:
From publisher blurb:

Animals of Myth and Legend!

Animals serve an important role in legends and folklore, and in few places is this more true than in the ancient lands of the Nile, home to such exotic and wondrous creatures as crocodiles, hippopotamuses, hawks, and serpents, to name a few. But while these creatures may be objects of importance in adventures set in the Nile (or other rich oases like it), they tend not to be very interesting at the game table. Animals rarely get special or unique abilities in their stat-blocks, meaning that they tend to make for rather dull or forgettable encounters, and their combat abilities are easily divorced from their in-game identity.

While this may be fine for average animals, and even their dire cousins, mythic animals demand something more. All four animals provided in this book have unique and exciting special abilities that truly make them mythic. Watch your players quake as a Nile hawk’s shadow passes over them, or surprise them with Nile crocodiles that, among other powers, are completely invisible when in water. The deadly Nile serpent, with its ability to transmute itself into water, can slip through nearly any barricade to get at potential prey in the night, and the fearsome Nile hippopotamus can swallow victims whole in a single, sudden gulp, and subject any survivors to the deadly Nile sweats disease, which is all but impossible to remove, and must be endured for its (mercifully short) duration.

157147.name: Urban Creatures & Lairs
157147.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product features descriptions and stat-blocks for twenty urban-based monsters using the rules presented in the Pathfinder Bestiary. In addition, each entry contains further information for how to use the creature in an encounter, encounter ideas, and for most of the entries, a fully detailed lair which you can simply drop into an adventure as a plug-and-play mini-adventure or encounter. While you might get a few less monsters than in a typical bestiary, our goal was to give you very usable monsters, and of course showcase 0one’s exquisite maps.

157148.description:
In Typo 2D, you try to play your cards next to cards already on table so that you can say words that start with the letter combinations in the rows or columns. In this game's predecessor, Typo from 2004, players placed letter cards in four separate rows; in Typo 2D, players can build "words" in two directions, crossing words as in crossword puzzles. The first player to play all of his cards wins.

In each game round, all players choose one of their hand cards, then reveal them simultaneously. In alphabetical order, players place their card adjacent to a card on the table to create or extend a row or column of letters. You must then say a word that starts with the letters in this row or column. If you extend a row and a column at the same time, you must say a word for the row and a word for the column. Once five or more rows/columns consist of at least two connected cards, you may place a letter only if you extend the length of a row or column to three cards or more.

If you cannot place a letter card because you can't create a word, then you must remove all cards from the longest row or column and add half of these cards to your hand. (Set the other cards aside as a penalty pile.) If you still can't place a letter in order to create a word, you must remove another word, etc.

If you place a letter card and connect separate areas of the grid — which were separated due to someone needing to remove a word — then you discard one of your penalty cards.

Typo 2D includes icons on some cards that can be used for variants, such as a card that can replace another card or a card you must place behind an empty spot and "fill in" the empty spot by saying a word.
157148.name: Typo 2D
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #203 - Beyond Scrabble

157149.name: Gauric Champions
157149.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Champions, the first book in the Gauric Myths series, you will find:

The basic character creation rules for making a fantasy hero.
Rules for 21 fantasy races.
Rules for 19 base classes, 7 NPC classes,and 13 prestige classes.
Information about alignments as well as 16 deities useable in any fantasy setting.
Rules for playing multiclass characters starting as early as 1st level.




Before you can be a hero, you must first know who you are.

157150.name: Gauric Methods
157150.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Methods, the second book in the Gauric
Myths series, you will find:

Descriptions and rules for over 30 skills.
Descriptions and rules for over 100 different feats.
Over 50 different weapons that can be used in any fantasy setting.
17 different armors and shields.
Descriptions of goods and services.
Information about special materials used in construct of weapons and armor.
Rules for carrying capacity and for breaking items and obstacles.




“It is dangerous to go alone. Take this sword.”
–Old man

157151.name: Gauric Journeys
157151.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Journeys, the third book in the Gauric Myths series, you will find:

Information about actions that can be taken in combat situations
Information about traveling and adventuring.
Descriptions of a variety of environments and the dangers and challenges of exploring them.
Information about different planes of existence.
Rules for special abilities and conditions that characters will encounter during their adventures.




A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a
single step.

157154.name: Gauric Grimoire
157154.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Grimoire, the fourth book in the Gauric Myths series, you will find:

Descriptions of hundreds of spells.
Spell lists for the classes introduced in Gauric Champions.
Rules for the basic functions of magic.




Knowledge is power, while wisdom is control.

157155.name: Gauric Rewards
157155.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Rewards, the fifth book in the Gauric Myths series, you will find:

Rules for awards for rewarding experience points.
Rules for rewarding treasure.
Guidelines for creating magic items.
Descriptions of magic weapons, armor, scrolls, wands, potions, rods, staffs, and wonderous items.
Descriptions of cursed, intelligent, and artifact items.




A job well done is its own reward, but getting paid for it isn't half-bad either.

157156.name: Gauric Challenges 1
157156.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Challenges 1, you will find:

Rules for traps.
Rules for two base classes and two prestige classes specifically for antagonists.
Rules for advancing creatures.
Over 100 different sentient races of Fey, Giants, Humanoids, Monstrous Humanoids, or Outsiders to befriend or challenge any adventuring group.




The most dangerous creature is not the one with claws and teeth, but the one who can outthink its prey.

157157.name: Gauric Challenges 2
157157.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Challenges 2, you will find:

Animals, from the mundane donkey to dinosaurs such as the tyrannosaurus.
Elementals, beings tied to one of the basic elements: air, earth, fire, or water.
Magical Beasts, including such fantasy classics as unicorns and sphinxes.
Plant creatures, such as Treants and Giant Flytraps.
Vermin creatures, such as monstrous spiders and giant ants.
Rules for Lycanthropes, such as werewolves.
Rules for Swarms of creatures.
Additional choices for Animal Companions and Paladin mounts.




The majestic fury of nature unleashed is both a wonder and a terror to behold.

157158.name: Gauric Challenges 3
157158.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 3.5 Open Game License System isn’t dead, it's UNDEAD!

In Gauric Challenges 3, you will find:

Otherworldly Aberrations, such as the Lovecraftian aboleth.
Magically powered Constructs, such as the clay golem.
Proud and deadly Dragons, such as the sadistic red dragon and the tiny pseudodragon.
Mindless Oozes, such as the gelatinous cube.
Risen Undead, such as skeletons, vampires, and zombies.




"He who fights with monsters should look to it that he himself does not become a monster. And when you gaze long into an abyss the abyss also gazes into you." -Friedrich Nietzsche

157159.name: Threes
videogamehonor: 2014 Apple Design Awards Best Overall Design of the Year Winner
2014 Global Game Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2014 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2015 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Sprite Award Nominee
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
157159.description:
Players slide numbered tiles on a four-by-four grid to combine factors of three. For example, ones and twos merge to become a single "three" tile, two threes merge into "six", and two sixes merge into "12". Swiping the screen up, down, left, or right moves all of the tiles on the grid in that direction and adds a new tile to the grid in the same direction. The color of the incoming tile is shown onscreen. Players can preview moves by sliding the grid without letting go. Each kind of number tile has its their own personality, and new kinds of number tiles are introduced with a screen full of confetti when first unlocked.

Games of Threes typically last several minutes and end when no moves remain on the grid (usually when gridlocked with a single high number tile and many low number tiles). When a game is finished, there is no "game over" screen, but players receive a final score based on the rarity of the tiles (rather than the tile number values). The object of the game is to earn a high score. Outside of the game, players can review their scores and set Game Center challenges.

Source: Wikipedia, "Threes!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

157161.description:
This is a Poker variant with a novel twist. Each player gets two cards and then tries to 'shoot' a ball into the spinner (rather like a Roulette wheel). You have four balls to shoot but you can stop if you think you have a card that improves your hand. Of course, there is a lot of scope for bluffing.

Game contains:
Board
Spinner
Playing Cards
Poker Chips
16 Plastic balls in four colours
Rules
157161.name: 7 Card Stud

157163.name: Rise of the Drow: Underworld Encounter Deck
157163.description:
Publisher Blurb

A full color deck of 120 premium cards for use with Rise of the Drow by Adventureaweek.com.

Even in times of war, life goes on for those that live in the Underworld. As the PCs travel from the surface to Embla, from Embla to the outskirts of Holoth, and then even into the city itself, they will encounter the citizens of this subterranean realm as they go about their business, whether that is a problem with a previously unseen ooze, a deep gnome hermit in the middle of a 100 year retreat or a government-sanctioned assassin returning, injured, from a kill, with an angry mob on her tail.

This deck of cards is made up of over 120 encounters that can be dropped into Embla, Holoth or any of the caverns and tunnels that run from the surface to the drow city. Prepare for the unexpected, for your players are quite likely to encounter it!

157164.description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of New York each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
157164.name: New York

157165.name: Super Sunday Football
157165.description: American Football game that uses bits of film to show the outcome of chosen plays. Each player uses a playbook, one for defense and one for the offence. Plays are chosen and the apt piece of film shows the outcome.

157166.description:
Bump up the challenge of your Dungeon Attack! adventures with the addition of these two event dice.

With the Trap Die, each time a player Bust the Door there is a chance a trap is triggered.

With the Labyrinth Die, each time a player Bust the Door, there is chance the adventurer has wandered off and is lost. That is why it is a good idea to never separate the party.

This pack contains two event dice and their respective optional rules cards.
157166.name: Dungeon Attack!: Event Dice

157167.description:
Action boxing game similar to Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots. Each player controls a boxer. The boxers face each other and start throwing punches. A clean punch to the nose will knock down that boxer. Play as long as you like, the one with the most knock-downs is the winner.

Included is a 45 rpm record of ring-side sound effects, which you can play in the background to build up the atmosphere.
157167.name: Knuckle Busters

157169.description:
Include these dice in your Dungeon Attack! games to battle against the taint that is chaos.

This set contains x4 Chaos Dice and rules card.

In game play a chaos hit taken taints the Adventurer preventing him or her from using any magic items. Ouch! Defeat these agents of evil quick before they weaken your group of heroes.
157169.name: Dungeon Attack!: Chaos Dice

157170.name: Ring Toss
157170.description:
Indoor target game. Each player in turn will take the three plastic rings and try to throw them over the post. Most successes wins.

It is advertised as being two games in one because you can choose the post to be in a fixed base or you can choose the slightly harder game where the post is fitted into a base that rocks around as you hit it.

157171.name: Alex builds his farm
157171.description:
Alex Builds his Farm: A game for children 7-10 in which the player helps Alex on his farm.

Source: Wikipedia, "Playmobil", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the game manual:

Alex is a lively and cheerful little boy who loves nature and animals. He often goes running along the forest paths with his dog Oscar. All the animals in the forest know him. Alex is also a great dreamer. Sometimes he sits under a tree and turns the pages of his favourite book: The Big Farming Book.
He sits there enjoying the sun, cooled by a gentle breeze. On such occasions Alex sometimes falls asleep and dreams of a magnificent farm with cows, funny little hens and affectionate horses. One day, Alex and Oscar went running in a field at the edge of the forest. In the middle of the field stood
a scarecrow to keep the crows away. When Oscar and Alex passed close to the scarecrow they heard a strange noise. Alex was surprised and looked all around, but couldn't see anything strange or unusual. Just as Alex and Oscar were about to continue their race, Alex heard the noise again. It was as if someone was calling him: - Psst! Pssst! Alex, it's me!
It was the scarecrow! Alex couldn't believe his eyes.
- But...! You can speak! said Alex in surprise.
-Yes, of course I can speak, said the scarecrow. But I only speak to children who like animals and nature. Like you, Alex!
The scarecrow had a big smile. He looked nice and funny at the same time. He spoke again:
-You know what Alex? I often see you sleeping under a tree in the forest. Did you know that when you dream in the middle of the forest, your dreams can come true?
- Er... No, I didn't know that, said Alex.
-Well, because you're a good little boy and you love nature so much, I'm going to tell you a secret: when you wake up, all you have to do is concentrate very intensely on your dream and do everything you canto make it come true!
- That's easy! said Alex.
- Yes! But above all, you mustn't forget to have fun! Other
wise, it's no longer a dream!
- Thanks, Mr Scarecrow! That's a great secret!
- Bye, bye!
As soon as Alex had finished talking with the scarecrow, he and Miro ran faster than ever in the direction of a large oak tree, the most majestic tree in the forest. Alex was keen to see if the scarecrow had been telling the truth. He sat down under the tree and shut his eyes. He listened to the birds sing
ing and the sound of the wind in the trees, but Alex couldn't manage to fall asleep. He was far too excited by the
scarecrow's secret! So he picked up his favourite book, the Good Farmer's Handbook and started to look at the pictures one after the other. Little by little, his eyelids shut and he fell asleep. And dreamt... He dreamt of his family, and a magnificent farm.

User addition: Alex Builds his Farm is a Playmobil videogame

157173.name: First Slay: Dein Weg ins Rollenspiel
157173.description:
User Summary
First Slay is a Dungeonslayers quick start, first released for the German Gratisrollenspieltag 2014 (print booklet and free download). It includes rules, a scenario, and pregenerated characters.

157174.name: Guidebook to the City of Dolmvay (Special Edition)
157174.description:
From publisher blurb:

From publisher blurb:

The Guidebook to the City of Dolmvay is a Labyrinth Lord supplement that details the people, layout, and government of the City of Dolmvay. The city is presented in broad strokes and is open to customization. It was specifically designed to give Labyrinth Lords a convenient and familiar city setting to place their adventures.

The Guidebook to the City of Dolmvay is largely open content. Small Niche Games would like to encourage professional and amateur publishers to use the Guidebook as a shared city setting and set their commercial adventures within the City of Dolmvay. Labyrinth Lords (and publishers) should feel free to change, add, or remove any of the information in this book to better suit his or her own game.

The Guidebook to the City of Dolmvay contains:

A breakdown of city-based adventure themes
History of the City of Dolmvay
Detailed overview of the City of Dolmvay including government, religion, commerce, and laws and punishment
Descriptions of over a dozen major festivals
An overview of the citizens of Dolmvay including a breakdown of social classes, daily life for commoners and nobles, style of dress, arms and armor, rumors and gossip, and common gestures, curses, and phrases
Layout of the city including details on architecture, street lighting, sanitation, as well as detailed descriptions of the city's wards, districts, quarters, neighborhoods, and businesses
Descriptions of dozens of factions and stat blocks for hundreds of NPCs
Descriptions of common shops and businesses, prices for food and lodging, and a dozen sample inns and taverns
Over 100 unique city encounters
Over two dozen new plants and monsters
A detailed description of the religious organization known as the Church of Law and Order including church history and doctrine, major NPCs, and new magic items
A detailed description of the Dolmvay Adventurer's Guild including training facilities, dungeons, and major NPCs
A detailed description of the city's magical sewer system including dozens of unique encounters and several sample sewer geomorph maps
Guidelines for NPC generation including common names, professions, dozens of quirks and traits, and rules for creating unique and interesting 0-level NPCs
Guidelines for random treasure determination including pick pocket tables and random tables for determining household treasures




This Special Edition Hardcover also contains the full-length adventure "Oak Grove Whispers", for 3-6 characters of 1st-3rd level!

157175.name: BeatBlasters III
157175.description:
BeatBlasters III is a platformer, puzzle and rhythm game all wrapped into one.

Play as Joey or Gina and defeat the tyrannical butcher prohibiting music in Accapella City. Use their powers to help the denizens of the land on their adventure back to the city.

Use the various BeatBlasters to defeat enemies and take on bosses. Use the shield to defend allies and send back projectile to enemies. Use the jet boots to reach higher grounds and to move around the map faster.

Follow the beat
Enter the recharge mode and hit the buttons on the beat to refill your powers' energy. The better you are the more energy you get!

Source: The Developer Website.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157176.name: Lost City of the Dwarves Part 2: Deliverance
157176.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have found the lost nation of Dwarves deep within their ruined city and defeated many of their enemies in the process. And while you stumbled into their realm as a novice adventurer with only the clothes on your back, you are now a 5th level Hero who has accumulated a small arsenal of enchanted weapons and items. It’s hard to believe that your adventure is only half over. The crucial finale of this historic event hangs in the balance, and you are the one to tip the scales in the Dwarves’ favour. In order to emerge victorious you must delve deeper into the Lost City of the Dwarves where you will find your greatest challenges yet, and even greater treasures. You may even accomplish the feat of becoming a living legend.

This is the sequel, solo-adventure that completes Lost City of the Dwarves Part 1: Discovery.

157177.name: A-Train 8
157177.description:
User Summary

This 8th installment in the A-Train franchise, a top-down railroad management game. It is the successor to A-Train EZ and A-Train HX and was followed by A-Train 9 two years later.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157178.name: Lost City of the Dwarves Codex II
157178.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free supplement, to be used with the adventure-novel Lost City of the Dwarves Part 2: Deliverance, will give you a better idea of what the Path of Legends world is all about. You can review the complete adventuring rules, check out the magical items to be found within the lost city, and even try your hand at the word puzzles, although you’ll need the complete story to claim those rewards for your character.

Also in these pages are the rules for Dwarven Battle Dice, an original dice game that is discussed more on the Pen & Forge website.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157179.name: Lost City of the Dwarves: Finale
157179.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free solo mini-adventure is a continuation of Prologue and and Interim and takes place during the first book in the Path of Legends world, Lost City of the Dwarves Part 1: Discovery. Set in a traditional fantasy setting, this new choose-your-own-adventure book uses basic d20 rules to allow you to adventure your way through the story with the familiar sword-slashing and potion-swigging flare of the "good ol' days."

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157180.name: Lost City of the Dwarves: Interim
157180.description:
From publisher blurb:
This free solo mini-adventure is a continuation of Prologue and takes place during the first book in the Path of Legends world, Lost City of the Dwarves Part 1: Discovery. Set in a traditional fantasy setting, this new choose-your-own-adventure book uses basic d20 rules to allow you to adventure your way through the story with the familiar sword-slashing and potion-swigging flare of the "good ol' days."

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157181.name: Lost City of the Dwarves: Prologue
157181.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free solo mini-adventure introduces the first book in the Path of Legends world, Lost City of the Dwarves Part 1: Discovery. Set in a traditional fantasy setting, this new choose-your-own-adventure book uses basic d20 rules to allow you to adventure your way through the story with the familiar sword-slashing and potion-swigging flare of the "good ol' days."

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157182.name: Lost City of the Dwarves: Multi-Player Rules
157182.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free rule supplement allows you to run multiple players through the first books in the Path of Legends world, Lost City of the Dwarves Part 1: Discovery and Lost City of the Dwarves Part 2: Deliverance. Set in a traditional fantasy setting, this new choose-your-own-adventure series uses basic d20 rules to allow you to adventure your way through the story with the familiar sword-slashing and potion-swigging flare of the "good ol' days."

157183.name: Echo of the Wilds
157183.description:
Echo of the Wilds is a puzzly narrativy adventure, featuring randomised wilderness survival.
Finding yourself in mysterious forests you must unfurl a spiritual tale of solace before the unending winter consumes all. There a spirit guide will help you learn the skills of survival and the secrets of the wilds: why you awakened there, their purpose, and how to finally be free from its clutches and malevolent apparitions.

The gameplay focuses on exploration and survival of the randomised wilds. Gathering resources to build gear and sustain yourself, learning new skills and the intertwining interactions between the various areas, seasons, and weather. The game includes 22 areas to discover and 157 items, including food, resources, tools, clothes, gear and furniture. There's also an 'Endless' game mode which removes all narrative to focus on simply surviving through the ever fiercer ages.

Source: The Developer Website.

157184.name: Carrera
157184.description:
This is a car racing game. The first player to complete a prior agreed upon number of laps wins the game. Each turn, each player moves the spinner two times. The first spin determines the the number of spaces he can move his car. The second spin results in an event, that can influence his movement or allow him to draw a card. The players start with 6 cards. The cards can be played to gain advantages for ones own movements or hinder the opponents movements. The colored segments on the race track symbolize speed limits, which can be exceeded by playing double-, triple- and risk cards.

This game was most likely published in the 1960s.

157185.name: Epigenesis
videogamehonor: 2013 Swedish Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
157185.description:
The game can be summarized with the following:

Ball game
Fast paced
Evolving Environments

Epigenesis is a love letter to Quake and Unreal Tournament’s Bombing Run. It is a mix of the games that we at DS3P miss from the time when we grew up, and we want to give that same experience but with a modern twist to today’s gamers. No matter if you are one of the old Quake players who miss the twitchy shooter, or if you think you know the meaning of the word “hectic”, Epigenesis has something for you.

Source: The Developer Website.

157186.name: MURI
157186.description:
User Summary

This game is a tribute to 1980's style DOS games in which you play a female rabbit-like warrior battling to discover the fate of Mars.

157187.name: Air Conflicts: Vietnam
157187.description:
Experience the Vietnam War, one of the most explosive wars of all time, that was fought extremely heavily armed! Witness the experiences of the brave pilots of the US Air Force.
After a battle there can never be only winners! Get yourself carried away by a thrilling and emotional story and, besides heroic moments, experience the dark sides of war.
Brand new missions, tailor-made for helicopter pilots! Besides jet fighter missions you must complete special helicopter missions, where the whole equipment of the choppers needs to be used.
Take control of whole squadrons! Instead of controlling just one airplane, you can control every aircraft in your squadron in the respective missions.
Equip your airplanes and helicopters with real weapons! All possible plane-weapons-combinations (chopper-weapons-combinations) are based on real models.
A real setting combined with arcade gameplay! Every airplane can only be equipped with a limited amount of ammunition. You can avoid this restriction as you switch between the different planes of a squadron.
A huge war machinery for you to choose from! The game contains a total of more than 20 airplanes and helicopters.

Source: The Publisher Website.

157188.name: Pole Position 2012
157188.description:
User Summary

You take control of managing a F1 team, doing everything from assembling cars and ordering spare parts to assigning drivers to specific tracks.

157189.name: Ride 'em Low
157189.description:
Enter the world of night racing and lowrider competitions. Buy your ride and keep it in a good condition to compete with other pretenders. Earn respect to race with better drivers and advance in the underground community to ultimately become the next racing king of the neighborhood.

Heaven for car tuners
Earn cash in night racers and spend the money to tune up your car in the garage to achieve the best performance. Change engine parts, switch gearboxes and other stuff to make your wheels spin as fast as possible. If you’re a good tuner, you’ll soon manage to pimp your ride – change tires and rims, lower the suspension and install hydraulics suspension system. Buy better cars and parts to advance your underground racing career.

Different game modes
Game features 2 main modes: racing and lowrider competitions. Meet other street racers and challenge them for duels on different racing locations. Once you installed hydraulics suspension system you’ll be able to enter lowrider competitions and compete in 3 different modes: jump, dance and freestyle.

Game features:
- 12 classic American lowriders
- 4 locations with plenty of race modes
- realistic gameplay physics
- advanced mechanic tuning options
- lowrider contest in 3 categories: hop, dance and freestyle
- dozens of car parts modifications

Source: The Developer Website.

157190.name: Towtruck Simulator 2015
157190.description:
In this simulation, the player works as the owner of a large car park, on which the vehicles towed will be stored. A huge fleet of different tow trucks are ready to go. The trucks are on the road to find illegally parked cars. For each car lifted you earn money, as being towed might be very expensive for the owner. Most of the money will be earned by driving the truck independently so fulfill your hard job carefully.

Features:
Huge city with dozens of parking spaces, streets and parks
Heavy city traffic with traffic lights and hundreds of cars
Various Tow Trucks with crane and ramp
Simulation of all hydraulic functions
3 game modes
Realistic sound effects and atmospheric music
High score list for all game modes

Source: The Publisher Website.

157191.name: Warehouse and Logistics Simulator
157191.description:
User Summary

This simulation game features you running a forklift and managing a warehouse.

157192.name: danZtyle
157192.description:
User Summary

In DanZtyle arrows continually fall from the top of the screen. When they reach the bottom of the screen you must press the corresponding arrow key at that time. You score points for timing well. You start the game with four stars and each time you miss an arrow you lose a star for each miss. Once you lose all four stars you lose the game.

157193.name: Fireball Forward: Britain's Lost Opportunity – Villers Bocage
157193.description: Villers-Bocage, Britain's Lost Opportunity is a book of tactical scenarios for the Fireball Forward! game system. It is centered around the British attack on the town of Villers-Bocage and the larger Operation Perch against German positions west of Caen, in Normandy, on 12-14 June 1944. It features engagements between the British 7th Armoured Division-the famed 'Desert Rats' - and the 50th Infantry Division against the elite German Panzer Lehr Division, the 2nd Panzer Division, and the 101 st 55 Heavy Panzer Battalion. 15 Scenarios cover the desperate struggle for the town of Villers-Bocage, 50th Infantry Division's attempt to drive Panzer Lehr out of its positions west of Caen, and panzer ace Michael Wittmann's daring, single-handed counterattack against a column of British armor that changed the course of the battle. A Campaign Game, an Historical Summary, Orders of Battle, and Designer's Notes are included to help put the scenarios in the larger context of operations in Normandy and allow players to design their own scenarios.

157194.name: Pumpkin Collector
157194.description:
User Summary

Control a man with a pumpkin on his head. Maneuver him so he goes over the pumpkins to collect them. Each level has fifty more pumpkins to collect than the previous starting with fifty for the first. But beware! For there are enemies and spikes to avoid. Failure to avoid these dangers will cost you lives.

157195.name: Cereus Peashy
157195.description:
User Summary

Sidescrolling action platforming game. Jump over obstacles, jump on enemies, throw spikes at enemies collect shycoins for extra lives.

157196.name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #8
157196.description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #8 is composed of 3 expansions:

Mad City: The Capitol
The Capitol tile can be used to expand the scoring of tiles that adjoin it. Clever placing and timing is the main key to using it.

Station Master: Flags & Whistles
Includes two tiles.

Tile #1: The Station Master's Whistle
After the first train leaves the Station and has been scored give the Whistle tile to the player with the lowest score. If there is a tie for lowest score then wait until the next train has left the Station - basically as soon as there is a clear lowest score that player is given the tile. They may use it at any time in the game to send any train out of the station early (as in immediately the whistle blows). However, if the tile hasn't been used and another player becomes the lowest scorer then they take the tile. The tile may only be used once during the entire game (that is ONCE not once per player) - put it back in the box when it has been used.

Tile #2: The Guard's Flag
This tile may also only be used once per game. It begins on the table next to the train stack. On their turn any player may decide to use the Flag instead of taking their normal turn (ie they do not get to play a carriage or place a passenger chit). The Flag is placed above a train which shows that the train has a fault and cannot be moved. Remove all the passenger chits and return them to their owners, then discard the carriages and the train engine - no one scores this train. After use place the Flag back in the box

Zen Garden: Raked Sand
The two tiles allow a player to remove and replace a previously played tile - except a feature tile with a cube on it already.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine issue #173.

157197.name: Planet Gobbler
157197.description:
User Summary

Control a giant mouth which consumes planets, but only eat the right color planet! Consume the correct colored planets to gain points and clear the current level. If you consume the wrong color planet however your game will be over.

157198.name: BagPacking Game
157198.description:
User Summary

In BagPacking Game you maneuver a brown paper bag along the bottom of the screen as groceries fall. At first they fall very slowly, but soon pick up speed. You get points for each grocery item you collect, but beware! If you miss a grocery item you will lose a life.

157199.name: Defenseless Stick
157199.description:
User Summary

Control a stick figure, and collect as many green orbs as you can. But beware for after each ten second interval a new obstacle will appear which has the potential to end your life. Try to score as many points as you can with the lives you have. At the beginning of each game you can select the number of lives you begin with either 30, 50 or 70 lives.

157200.name: Road of Fury
157200.description:
User Summary

Upgrade heavy shooting game. Start with one vehicle and upgrade it's weapons system defense and special ability. You can also purchase up to two additional vehicles for your group. The farther you get the more money you earn so you can continue to increase the power of your vehicles and purchase even more powerful vehicles. Some vehicles not only must be purchased but unlocked by reaching a certain distance. The extent of the gameplay is operating the weapon systems and some of the special abilities, you do not control the vehicles at all. This is an upgrade heavy game. Playing well means you earn more money to buy better vehicles. Playing poorly means it will take longer to buy the better vehicles.

157201.name: Mole Hunter
157201.description:
User Summary

Use your hammer to take out the moles attacking your garden. There are a number of holes that the moles might pop out of, and you need to be ready to hit them when they do! When a mole pops up drag your cursor over to it, and whack it with a right click. Score points for every mole that you hit. Try to score the most points you can before time runs out.

157202.name: Halloween Mayhem
157202.description:
User Summary

Many enemies run around the screen. Punch them to make them disappear and then grab the lollipops they leave behind. Try to grab as many lollipops as you can within the time limit. You can also find items that give you extra time and the faster you grab them the more extra time they provide.

157203.name: 6-Minute Princess
157203.description:
The life simulation game 6-Minute Princess uses incremental deck manipulation to represent the progression of each player’s adopted daughter from age 10 to age 18.

In 6-Minute Princess, each player works to raise his or her child to succeed in a trade or profession of her choosing. By learning a trade, each player’s daughter can focus and increase her physical attributes to build a foundation for her later career; money she earns by practicing her trade can help pay tuition for schooling to align her skills with her ultimate goal.

By overseeing his or her daughter’s training, leisure activities, and diet, each player may choose to steer his or her daughter’s progress toward any among the number of endings available exclusively to her in a particular game; but each player’s ultimate success depends not on the relative prestige of the career he or she chooses for his or her daughter, but rather on his or her daughter’s success in that career: A hunter who knows her trade may do better in life than a princess who cannot inspire the love of her subjects.

Players construct their daughters’ character decks gradually all year long, building toward the yearly harvest festival, in which each player’s daughter can compete against other contestants in a variety of contests to win prestige, prizes, and royal favor. During the festival, players enter any contests of their choosing by selecting hands of cards from their daughters’ character decks, then playing out those hands of cards against the other players in each contest. Cards won increase each daughter’s reputation in her associated skill and raise her likelihood of encountering rivals striving in those same skills during the rest of the year. Cards saved back from the contest form each player’s daughter’s character deck for the next year, helping her focus her work and training as she prepares for the next festival and, ultimately, aims at her chosen destiny.

Players who feel confident in their daughters’ training can go adventuring outside the confines of the capital city in hopes of finding help unavailable through normal means, whether from new acquaintances, after defeating enemies, through fairy meetings, or in undiscovered troves. Those who focus chiefly on schooling can benefit from the benevolence of the various deities who oversee the various mental and physical arts in the kingdom. And those whose skills lend themselves less toward adventuring and training and more toward society can try to find their place in the capital’s social life by cultivating helpful relationships among those who live in the palace—and can eventually aspire to a position among the kingdom’s nobility, perhaps even its royalty.

But raising a daughter isn’t easy. Keeping her healthy means feeding her well, and both feeding her and training her cost money. Yet the work she does to help earn that money can increase her resentment if she feels too much is being required of her—if she works or studies too long without time to herself, if she wears herself out adventuring without time vacationing to renew her energy. And if her resentment grows, she may fall into delinquency, may even run away from home without considering the consequences of abandoning her schooling or missing a festival.

So it’s up to you to do what you can to shepherd her through the difficulties of growing up, teaching her how to work and how to learn and giving her skills for the life she eventually chooses to live. She may not be grateful at the time, but as you teach her to be moral and industrious, to work hard at getting ahead, she will come, in the end, to be thankful for the discipline you’ve helped her maintain during her formative years.

And when she turns 18, your job is over: She is of age, free to follow her own path in life. And you can only hope she feels kindly toward you for the role you played in her upbringing, for the tools you have helped her equip herself with. Because whatever part she chooses to play among those who live in the capital city—even in the kingdom overall—it is you who helped give her the chance to choose that path, and you who prepared her to succeed in it. Your parenting skills will be reflected in her success.

157204.name: Sunda
157204.description:
The goal of the game ist to get points by enclosing opponent playing pieces. The players can set their pieces (with their faces down) on any free space on the game board. When all pieces are set, the players beginn to move their pieces one space per turn. If a piece is enclosed, so that it can't move, its face is revealed. It's eliminated from the game and the encloser gets the indicated number of points, but only if a black inscripted piece is caught on a space with a black center or a white inscripted one on a space with a white center. If this is not the case, the enclosed piece is put on any other free space of it's players choice. When a 6-eyed piece is eliminated, it's player too is eliminated from the game.

This game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

157205.name: Am Knobelbrett
157205.description: The players set their playing pieces face down on the spaces of their color on the game board. Only the spaces with the number 10 are left free. When all pieces are set, the faces are revealed. Now the players have to move their pieces to get them on the spaces of the same number. Spaces of other colors can't be moved on. Neutral spaces can be used to block the opponents. The first player to get all his pieces on the right spaces wins the game.

157206.name: Ropelopedia Nordica
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
157206.description:
Translated from back of the book:
ROPELOPEDIA NORDICA
This book is the first encyclopedia of the RPG industry in Finland if not first in the world. Despite it's small size R.N. includes a great deal of totally ineffectual and unneccesary information.

Only after reading this book you can even try to claim you know something about roleplaying. This book familiarizes you even with the Concepts of this Field such as Fantasiapelit, Dungeons and Dragons, Lauri Tudeer, Games Workshop, Gary Gygax and also Matti & Teppo.

Without this book it might be possible to live, but is it worth taking the risk?

In finnish:
ROPELOPEDIA NORDICA
Tämä kirja on ensimmäinen roolipelialan hakuteos Suomessa ellei peräti koko maailmassa. Pienestä koostaan huolimatta R.N. sisältää suuren määrän täysin epäkuranttia ja tarpeetonta tietoa.

Vasta tämän kirjan luettuasi voit edes yrittää väittää tietäväsi jotakin roolipelaamisesta. Tämä teos tutustuttaa sinut jopa sellaisiin Alan Käsitteisiin kuin Fantasiapelit, Dungeons and Dragons, Lauri Tudeer, Games Workshop, Gary Gygax sekä Matti & Teppo.

Ilmankin tätä kirjaa voi olla mahdollista elää, mutta kannattaako ottaa riski?

157207.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 70 (catching Tom, an orang-outan)
- smple 'Roll&Move' game -
acting by turns
Tom (an orang-outan, kept as prisoner/domestic animal in a palace) has escaped. Rolling two dice (with special symbols) 5 pawns (players) have to catch the break-away; depending on dice combinations pawns/orang outan have to be moved; ending on marked spaces follow instructions.

notes:
likely published before WWI;
cute pewter pawns, funky story behind
157207.name: Das lustige Affenspiel

157208.name: Mundus RPG Quickstart
157208.description:
User summary:
The Mundus RPG Quickstart book PDF includes introduction to both the rules of Mundus RPG and to the fictional fantasy world of Tentaika.

The game rules are covered extensively, including combat and arcane rules. Also included are several pre-made characters but the character generation is only presented in the full book. The gamemaster section provides an adventure that is suggested to be used as beginning of a campaing. The full book will present a few more campaing seeds. In the end of the quickstart PDF is a collection of tables needed for the game.

157209.name: Hounds of War
157209.description:
Hounds of War is a standardized skirmishing miniatures rules system which allows the players (with maximum flexibility during the CREATION phase) to be able to take ANY 25-30mm figures, assign them the game values the players WANT, and be able to bring them into play. With Hounds of War you will be able to pit World War II Nazi Storm Troopers against your favorite Goblin Hoards, or even Star Wars© Storm Troopers!

This is a stand-alone set of rules, so no other rules are necessary for play. In addition, you WILL need your own miniatures, a LOT of 10-sided dice (d10), marking chits, 3D terrain, rulers marked in inches, and your imagination to play this game.

Instead of being a "you-go-I-go" turn sequence, an initiative deck is used and cards assigned to individual units to determine when units perform actions are performed in a turn. This creates a fast paced game in which players are constantly active.

157210.name: D20 Paranoia
157210.description:
user summary:
A total conversion of Paranoia and signature features to the d20 system. Fan-created and unlicensed.

The rules contain everything required for character generation, task and combat resolution, setting-specific information and rules, and game master advice for running Paranoia.

Table of Contents:

Introduction
Chapter 1: Character Creation
Chapter 2: Skills
Chapter 3: Feats
Chapter 4: Mutant Powers
Chapter 5: Secret Societies
Chapter 6: Equipment
Chapter 7: Combat
Chapter 8: Non-Combat Perils
Chapter 9: R&D Devices
Chapter 10: Creatures and Opponents
Chapter 11: Background Data
Chapter 12: Being a Paranoia GM
Chapter 13: Paranoia Missions
Appendix A: Character Sheet
Appendix B: Name Lists
Appendix C: Psychological Tests
Appendix D: Drugs
Appendix E: Bots as PCs

157211.name: D20 Paranoia lite
157211.description:
user summary:
A total conversion of Paranoia and signature features to the d20 system. Fan-created and unlicensed.

The rules contain everything required for character generation, task and combat resolution, setting-specific information and rules, and game master advice for running Paranoia.

This edition of the rules features smaller page margins, blank pages are omitted and several appendices are not included. The page count is roughly half of the full version of the d20 Paranoia rules.

Table of Contents:
Introduction
Chapter 1: Character Creation
Chapter 2: Skills
Chapter 3: Feats
Chapter 4: Mutant Powers
Chapter 5: Secret Societies
Chapter 6: Equipment
Chapter 7: Combat
Chapter 8: Non-Combat Perils
Chapter 9: R&D Devices
Chapter 10: Creatures and Opponents
Chapter 11: Background Data
Chapter 12: Being a Paranoia GM
Chapter 13: Paranoia Missions
Appendix A: Character Sheet
Appendix B: Name Lists

157212.name: Villain Gazette Volume 1, Issue 8
157212.description:
From publisher blurb:


For Great Victory, Great Villains!

Sometimes, you just need stuff to beat up. Here, in the Villain Gazette, we provide a villain, their minions, and some cool new stuff for both sides to use. In this issue:

Fantasy Era Mistress of Potions, Baer Alkkem!
Baer's Minions, the Alchemy Golems!
A selection of dozens of potions!
