See the Villain's stats, learn their secrets, and prepare to depooy them on PCs in need of conflict. Includes the Redeemability Scale rating of the villlain (so you know if they can be salvaged), and Adventure Seeds for bringing the villain into YOUR campaign!

157213.name: Faewood Loft
157213.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Elves of Faewood found no peace living in the shadows of the ancient trees, so they built their town high above the troubles of the world below. Faewood Loft is a treetop village, perched high above the misty forest of Faewood. Homes are made in hollowed trees or on wooden platforms, strung together with a network of ropebridges and walkways. At night the fruit of the trees give out a pale blue glow, illuminating the walkways and platfirms of Faewood Loft.

Faewood Loft is the perfect location for numerous adventures - a town of wood elves, forest dwelling goblins - even an Ewok village if you're playing Star Wars! Provided with both day and night versions, this geomorphic set is very versatile.
Faewood Loft is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Faewood Loft is a geomorphic set, comprising 10 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. (Day and night versions of 5 different tiles). Each tile features a treetop village, with hollowed trees, walkways and ropebridges.
Included: Single & double doors new for Faewood Loft, and extra rope bridges.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg).

157214.description:
Objective: Collect as many bonus points as possible by crossing a 11 x 11 board (+ start/target positions) like Halma by
1. capturing other meeples 2. fast finishing
- acting by turns -

Players (2 or 4) move their meeples (vertical/horizontal/diagonal) out of starting position upon a 11 x 11 grid board. The board is divided into 4 areas, pictured with Skat-cards; starting from such a place you may move or jump trying to come closer to your finish positions; if you jump over opponent's meeple(s) you will capture them - but this isn't allowed if your starting position has a lower or equal value (according Skat). You may jump in all directions ('chain-jump') starting from a Jack-(=Jungs)space. Transition spaces between the 4 areas have additional restrictions/advantages. The earlier you finish the higher the bonus points. Game ends after last player reaches target positions.

Note:
Likely published during 1930's
157214.name: Jungs

157215.name: The Yacht
157215.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 32 x 30 inch, Black and White Blueprint of a Yacht.

The Product comes with the Hex, Square and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“Don’t be fooled by their pretty boy and girl looks. Every one of these men and women could be a drug dealing criminal scumbag. If you let your guard down, even for a second, you are dead.”

The Yacht is a hand-drawn, black and white, blueprint style map. The product includes the five decks of a large yacht or cruise ship. Each individual area in the yacht is labeled and includes hand-drawn objects signifying all of the furnishings in the area.

The Yacht is intended for use in modern games. It could also easily be used in near future science fiction games.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Smuggling with a Smile: A group of drug runners are using a large yacht or cruise ship as a way to smuggle drugs from Florida to Cuba. Posing as a party cruise ship, they offer passengers a great time at very competitive prices, using the tickets fees as a way to get additional funds as well as acting as a cover for their drug smuggling activities. As additional security, they even hire “passengers” who are actually paid mercenaries disguising themselves as vacationers.

Detectives have become quite suspicious of the always full capacity cruise ship and ever more frequent trips between Florida and Cuba. They decide to send in their youngest and most comely officers who have the highest chance of passing themselves off as young partygoers to investigate the ship. The Player Characters as young detectives have to make their way on board, and then search the ship for evidence of wrongdoing. Meanwhile, any passenger or servant could actually be a drug smuggler or mercenary in disguise trying to stop them…

157216.name: Illuminatus: The Chaos Mage
157216.description:
From publisher blurb:

ILLUMINATUS- MASTERS OF CHAOS MAGIC...
There are those that seek magic in high-towered schools, and those that are born to create magic from the legacy of their ancestors- and then there is chaos magic. To embrace the will of the universe and let the waves of chaos magic roll over oneself is not for everyone- as a chaos magic-using Illuminatus, you must use your wits, abilities, and the random chance of entropy to succeed, thrive, and show the world the ancient paths of The Illuminates of Chaos! This fascinating supplement details the illuminatus class, who use iconic arcane implements to guide their path through the myriad multiplicities of chaos magic, where you just never know what form your magically-cast Wonder will bring! Including spell tables, feats, magic items, and a first-level sample character, ILLUMINATUS- MASTERS OF CHAOS MAGIC is a challenging variant for the adventurous player to try, master and go beyond the restrictive rules of magical adventure!

A new chaos magic wielding base class (20-level)
Favored class bonuses for a multitude of core and 3PP races.
10 new feats for illuminatus and non-illuminatus characters
Class options for clerics, rogues, sorcerers, and wizards
A handful of new spells
Magic items, mythic support, mishaps and more...

157217.name: Peir and the Big Black Hole
157217.description:
User Summary

Peir must avoid objects as they are sucked into a black hole. Get points for every object avoided. Objects can appear from any part of the screen and the black hole moves around the screen. Jump move to left and right and move between several levels to avoid the objects.

157218.name: Zombies Revenge (Web browser)
157218.description:
User Summary

You are a zombie held captive by scientists, but now you have escaped and will take your revenge. A sidescrolling action game. Collect weapons and use on scientists. Avoid objects and jump on platforms to get through each level.

157219.name: Sledder!
157219.description:
User Summary

Control a sledder sliding down a hill. Maneuver left and right to avoid the trees. Score more points the longer you survive. If you hit a tree, it's game over!

157220.name: Bridge (Web Browser)
157220.description:
User Summary

In Bridge you control a raft that can be placed in one of three positions. There is a pirate tossing objects off of a boat. Move the raft so it is under the objects and if the object hits the raft it will bounce off. Try to bounce the objects enough times that they reach the shore. If you miss the object will be lost in the water!

157221.name: Little Fist
157221.description:
User Summary

Two player simultaneous fighting game. One player uses arrow keys and numbers the other player WASD and letters. Hit your opponent with attacks and diminish their life bar to win. If you are low on life, you can grab a life item to restore some life.

157222.name: Night of the Living Blam
157222.description:
User Summary

Move around the screen killing Blam's that have returned from the dead. Your character is invulnerable so get to hacking. If a Blam hits your weapon it will die, you need not swing it. Kill the Blam's quickly so they don't build up and overwhelm you.

157223.name: Mobility Meteor Shower
157223.description:
User Summary

Control a satellite, and move around on the screen to avoid the meteors of life. Use the spacebar to use the energy shield, but remember you can only use it three times. The longer you last, the better you have done!

157224.name: Hunter's Trophy 2 Europa
157224.description:
Seek and hunt 25 different preys (fox, wild boar, doe...) through 5 beautiful landscapes of Europe. You will be helped by your dog and a lot of sophisticated hunting equipment. You can train on the "shooting range" mode before getting to the main modes : "Hunting season" and "Hunting weekend".

Three game modes : hunting season, shooting range and hunting week end
Five environments : the Camargue marshes, the Corrèze plains, the Swiss Alps, Highland lakes and the Black Forest
25 different types of prey : Boar, deer, fox, chamois, hare, pheasant, duck...
Three types of hunting : Tracking, stalking and beating
30 different hunting plans to complete
10 unlockable weapons

Source: The Developer Website.

157225.name: UFOMania
157225.description:
User Summary

Control a UFO which is abducting humans and taking them to another planet. Use your mouse to maneuver the UFO and click to use the abductor beam. Collect humans in the beam while avoiding hostile humans shooting you with rockets.

157226.name: Police Force
157226.description:
User Summary

This police simulation deals with anything from traffic problems all the way to car theft and murder. The player's aim is to keep the peace by being a police officer (with the option to switch to a partner's persona) using provided equipment and vehicles to respond to crime.

157227.name: Ski Park Tycoon
157227.description:
The core gameplay mechanics of Ski Park Tycoon lie in ski lift and slope construction. Before building a park, the player needs to study the mountain topography and terrain. Therefore, it was imperative to allow the player complete freedom of camera movement. Building lifts and slopes is as easy as drawing lines on the ground. Skiers coming to the resort want to enjoy their stay so - apart from lifts and slopes - the player also needs to provide other infrastructure such as restaurants, ski patrols, snow cannons etc. This is where the economic simulation aspect of the game comes into play.

Source: The Game Website.

157228.name: The Yaqqothl Netbook
157228.description:
subtitle:
a micro sandbox

user summary:
A dark fantasy micro-setting consisting of a numbered hex map with 13 keyed locations, a rumour table and terrain-based random encounter tables. The location key provides only a brief description of each site with no game specific information.

Sample location description:
0907 The Monastery of Renewed Pain

Ruled by Father Garxygyg. A group of about 100, mad monks live here, committed to prayer, copying old tomes of lost knowledge, cultivating the land and producing a fine malt beer. They are all devoted to the Demon Lords of Sarnath, and keep a vow of chastity.

157229.name: ASE1 Map Pack
157229.description:
designer's blog comment:
One unfortunate problem with on-demand printing is that the printers don't do anything "fancy," like separate maps that you can pull out from the book and look at. This makes running the module a little tricky, since you have to flip around a lot.

So to help with that problem, I put together a PDF of all the maps in the ASE1 module and have made it available for download.

157230.name: ASE2-3 Map Pack
157230.description:
user summary:
Patrick Wetmore provides a complimentary maps and handout booklet for ASE2-3: Anomalous Subsurface Environment: Dungeon Levels 2 & 3.

designer comment on the ASE1 Map Pack:
One unfortunate problem with on-demand printing is that the printers don't do anything "fancy," like separate maps that you can pull out from the book and look at. This makes running the module a little tricky, since you have to flip around a lot.

157231.description:
Prototype is a new Mechanism Card for the Mars Needs Mechanics game. Just add it into the Mechanism Card deck at the beginning of the game. This card costs two Scrap and provides the following ability:

"At the end of a round after prices change, you may break this mechanism down and sell both scrap. If you do, sell one for the value of the highest valued component, and the the other for the value of the lowest valued component."

Note: This card was included in the Unpub 4 Promo Card Pack.
157231.name: Mars Needs Mechanics: Prototype

157233.name: Between Worlds (Issue 1 - Jul 1985)
157233.description:
Premier Issue

From the Introduction:

We would like to thank Marc Miller for talking to us and giving us permission to make a Traveller fanzine. And to Ed Edwards of "Working Passage" for his help and the example of his fanzine.

From the credits:

The date of this issue is 212/1111.

From the 'From the Editor's Desk' article in issue 2:

As to our first issue. We realize that it said June on its cover and July inside, and that we mailed them in December.

157234.name: ASE Character Tumbler
157234.description:
designer's comment:
I decided to rewrite my character tumbler for Basic Fantasy for ASE (and for Basic D&D). The layout is the same, but the professions are all fresh and are, dare I say it, cleverer and more likely to produce amusing gameplay. I also took the liberty of crafting logos and slogans for the two pre-apocalyptic corporations that (SPOILER) unearthed the Anomalous Subsurface Environment—check all this out after the jump.

For those unfamiliar with the concept, a character tumbler (or funnel, as the genius inventors at DCC RPG call it) starts each player off with four sadsack 0-Level characters who are forced into a dungeon. Each has -100 XP, and most will die quickly. But those who survive to 1 XP attain Level 1, and become full-fledged PCs.

user note:
The designer states that this character tumbler is written for Basic D&D, this will also work with Labyrinth Lord.

157235.name: Between Worlds (Issue 2 - Jan 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Freelance Adventure: The Sword of Phlume
157235.description:
From the credits:

The date of this issue is 22/1112.

157236.name: Between Worlds (Issue 3 - Mar 1986)
157236.description:
From the credits:

The date of this publication is 90/1112.

157237.name: Between Worlds (Issue 4 - May 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Freelance Adventure: Rescue from the Selai
157237.description:
From the credits:

The date of this publication is 151/1112.

Cover art "Gazelle Close Escort on patrol" by Magnus Abel

157238.name: Between Worlds (Issue 5 - Jul 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Freelance Adventure: Doom of the Blue Planet
Freelance Adventure: Peril on Planet Beta-D-163
157238.description:
From the credits:

The date of this publication is 181/1112.

Cover Art by Phil Morrissey.

157239.name: Between Worlds (Issue 6 - Sep 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Alien Encounter: Encountering the Dragon's Wrath, Part 2
Freelance Adventure: Old Man Boltzmann & the SPICA
157239.description:
From the credits:

The date of this publication is 273/1112.

Cover art "Thunderkitten Supersport..new in '45'" advertisement by Phil Morrissey.

157240.name: Arrow Wizard
157240.description:
User Summary

In Arrow Wizard arrows appear on the screen, and you have to press the corresponding arrow key within the time limit. Each time you miss, or press the wrong arrow key you lose a life. The better you play the higher your score will be.

157241.description: These are "real" Somnium crystals that can be used in place of the plastic Somnium crystals provided with Wiraqocha. Given away as a promo.
157241.name: Wiraqocha: Real Somnium from Wiraqocha

157242.name: Hop To The Top
157242.description:
User Summary

Control a ball with the arrow keys. There are platforms to jump onto and you try to get as high as you can. There are also power ups you can get, some are helpful but some are bad so you have to be careful which you grab.

157243.name: Icy Madness
157243.description:
User Summary

In Icy Madness control a zamboni and try to clean the ice. When a dirty bit of ice appears clean it as fast as possible! But beware because if you run out of gas or out of time your game will end. Luckily there are crazy fans running on the ice, and if you run them over you will get extra gas or time. You can unlock a local co-op version with unlimited gas.

157244.name: Jumping Clowns
157244.description:
User Summary

In Jumping Clown there are six clowns. They bounce in a specific sequence and you have to remember the sequence they bounce in. After they are done bouncing your hammer appears and then you have to hit the clowns in the same order they bounce in.

157248.name: Viviparous Dumpling
157248.description:
Game instructions

The object of Vivaporous Dumpling is to maneuver the fetal dumpling around with your mouse by grabbing moving and throwing him into nutrient rich sperm that fills his mothers womb but be sure to avoid the evil Toxoplasm! Four hits from them is all it takes to turn your embryonic body into fetus soup.

157249.name: Squid evader
157249.description:
User Summary

Avoid the enemies for as long as you can. You play as a squid and must avoid a hamster, whale and crab. Grab the krill for a delicious treat. You also must take care to avoid the sides of the screen. Hitting the sides of the screen or an enemy will end your game. Try to score as many points as you can.

157250.name: Run Run Shoot
157250.description:
User Summary

The screen is continually scrolling and a demon is chasing you. Other enemies appear on the screen and you must shoot or avoid them. You have a pistol, and unlimited ammunition. Last as long as you can to score the most points.

157251.name: Marquette-opoly
157251.description:
Own it all as a high-flying trader in the fast-paced world of real estate. Tour the city for the hottest properties: sites, stations and utilities are all up for grabs. Invest in houses and hotels, then watch the rent come pouring in. Make deals with other players and look out for bargains at auction—there are many ways to get what you want. And for really speedy dealers, use the speed die for a quick and intense game of Marquette-opoly. So get on Go and trade your way to success.

Players move around the gameboard buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels, and collecting rent from their opponents, the ultimate goal being to drive them into bankruptcy. The winner is the remaining player left after all the others have gone bankrupt.

157252.name: Plague-Stricken Halls
157252.description:
designer's website blurb:
Happy Swords & Wizardry Appreciation Day! Although I haven’t played much of it, S&W strikes me as a great system—clearly written, it retains the spark of the Original rules while smoothing out some of the more incomprehensible quirks. Best of all, it’s eminently hackable; indeed, the S&W creators go farther than almost anyone in enabling you to hack your own system onto S&W. …

The module is dubbed IDA0: Plague-Stricken Halls. In it, a lawful goblin fortress has been overrun by a strange plague, leaving its wonderful magical riches free for the taking. Among these are a Font of Ever-Burning Oil, and a Ring of Forbidden Fruit which turns your own skeleton against you! The module also includes new monsters, a nifty map, and of course a fully-keyed dungeon.

It’s written for my own house setting, Terra Pericolosa, which is set on medieval earth. As such, the goblins were mostly Catholics, and I’ve sprinkled Biblical allusions throughout the text. If there’s interest, I might do a follow-up post on Terra Pericolosa. For your own games, it could easily be adapted and dropped into any hexcrawl.

157254.description:
Now you command Soviet and NATO forces during the first battles of the Third World War. Seven scenarios give you the opportunity to explore the desperate fighting in the Eisenbach Gap and Gerzenburg. Dawn's Early Light: Red Hammer is the 2nd expanded edition of Dawn's Early Light and now includes the High Noon at Gerzenberg expansion from Line of Fire magazine #10. Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer is set in a hypothetical 1985 as World War 3 starts. The game uses variable initiative, support element chit pulls, and a novel combat resolution mechanic to create a game modeling the lethality of the modern battlefield with a minimum of rules overhead.

Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer has been refined, corrected, and polished. This edition has updated game manual, counters, player aid card and map. The game map is now printed on a heavy paper stock in vibrant color and also includes a newly designed full-color box. Players can control forces of America, Canada, West Germany and the Soviet Union.

Dawn's Early Light Red Hammer is easy to learn and play in an evening, so get ready to play.
157254.name: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 3, Episode Three-o!
The GrogCast, Episode 12

157255.name: Level 0 Character Tumbler
157255.description:
designer's comment:
…one bit of DCCRPG really captured my imagination: The character funnel, which turns four sad-sack level-0 characters into one level 1 PC by the power of dice and almost-certain death.

The character funnel brings a very OSR approach to a very OSR problem. The problem is that most retro-styled games have very swingy character creation. The beloved Iron Man stat generation system (roll 3d6 in order for each ability) is particularly bad in this regard. …

DCC’s OSR solution is very nifty: It accelerates the building of that character history. Let’s outline it briefly: Each player creates four level-0 PCs. Each of these receives a tiny fragment of personality and backstory: A race, profession, and a few meager possessions. You then send these sadsacks through the meat-grinder of a typical D&D dungeon. The few who manage to claw their way from -100 XP to 1 XP attain level one, and get a class and a proper place in the campaign.

The idea, then, is that players learn to love the idiots who survived simply because they’re the ones who managed to beat the odds. …

It’s a damned great idea. But I wanted to use it with my system of choice, rather than DCC, and I wanted a free version of the idea so even non-DCC players could enjoy it. So I wrote up a Basic Fantasy version (.pdf; .odt also available).1 This should work just fine with most other OSR games, as well, though you’ll need to adjust saves and AC.

157256.name: Babeball Teaser
157256.description:
User Summary

Run super fast and last as long as you can. The track will move around on you, so better keep an eye out. And it might disappear so you gotta jump.

157257.name: GETSOME
157257.description:
Operation World Party Gaming introduces GETSOME, GETSOME: Bad Decisions, and GETSOME: Ladies night, which are a series of naughty games for normal people.

GETSOME is a 2-4 'player' non-collectible card game, expandable up to 5-6 players with purchase of the expansion, Bad Decisions, and the deck can be enlarged through purchase of the first booster, Ladies Night. The goal is simple: earn yourself 10 Bed Notches while avoiding the consequences of your actions such as lost turns, Clingy Exes, STDs, and babies. The dialogue is both horrible and hilarious. Play is quick as everyone has the ability to play cards on another person's turn. A player will have seven cards in their hand and can GETSOME, become PREGGOS, gain a Status Effect, heal a Status Effect, or block a player from a GETSOME or PREGGOS encounter. Don't forget to call in your Wingman when the time is right.

The heart of the game is the story telling, where you'll create the details of your deeds and how you overcame difficult challenges presented by your so-called friends in pursuit of your next conquest. Your evening will be filled with buddies, belly laughs, and blushing cheeks of the newly acquainted.

The heart of the replayability is in the multifunction design of many of the cards to perform different tasks depending on your needs. There are an unlimited number of ways for rounds to play out. There's an amazing breadth of crazy things you'll hear yourself say over the course of the night, and a card for just about every occasion. Once you GETSOME, you're definitely going to want to GETSOME again.

157258.name: Nexus d20 Core Rules
157258.description:
from Nexus D20 Core Rules - Ch 1: Overview:
Nexus is a Universal D20 based RPG. Nexus is a system and a universal setting. Through it you can run any world or genre you want. Several different genre settings are laid out. You can have characters cross over from any genre that your GM wants to allow. This system can be used for a single game or a multiverse game. You can use it to play this setting, your own setting, or even published settings that you like but don't like their system. …

There are several important differences with standard D20 that may confuse players at first. This was born out of SRD20 but it has evolved into its own system. …

All dice rolls in Nexus D20 are made with a single D20. A considerable effort has been made to reduce the number of dice rolls involved in any one action. This increases the speed of play and gets you back into the story that much faster. Everything is a skill check now. There is no separate damage roll for attacks.

157259.name: Royaumes Africains
157259.description:
A print'n play, pit and peebles inspired African themed game. During the medieval times, kingdoms and empires rise and fall in the African continent.

The object of the game is simple, it uses a mancala/oware/awele style mechanic.

As a player, take control of one of the four kingdoms, rise, expand, and collect resources before falling.

You will do so using a "pit and pebbles" gaming mechanic, sowing your cubes and harvesting with the last cube you sow.

You will also use cubes from new comers (Europeans, Chinese, Persians, Arabs...) as Africa become a land of conquest.
You can sow and harvest player cubes with these cubes, but you can't harvest new comers' cubes.

So new comers will slowly gain control of the land as players use them, and players' kingdoms will fall.

At the end of the game, when there are no more players cubes, the winner is the player who has harvested the most cubes.

The game is for 2-4 players, from 6 y.o. The board is language independent, rules are in French, soon in English.

157260.description:
Objective: score most goals (450 points or more) during a 2 x 6 matches lasting game
- acting by turns -
2 or 4 players (in this case you need two sets/games with 4 different colours) are dealt 5 cards each (from their own 32 cards deck); trying to score most points in a trick-taking procedure you earn bonus points regarding the values of the cards (within their won tricks); special card combinations (center-forward & goal & Joker) give additional points. After each trick you must refill your hand.

notes: likely published mid/end 1930's due to Joker card 'Sindelar': Team captain of the Austrian Wunderteam - died Jan. 1939 under mysterious circumstances
157260.name: "GOAL"

157261.name: Present Day Cthulhu (Fate)
157261.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cthulhu Mythos is an excellent backdrop for any Fate Core campaign. This book includes a present day Cthulhu setting and a compact version of the Fate Core rules, so you have everything you need to confront cosmic horrors in one place.

This 136-page book provides Mythos locations, Monsters, NPCs, the Dreamlands, an example scenario, several cults, a secret history of the Earth, and uncanny Mythos tomes, with the spells and powers they contain.

The Earth is doomed and there is nothing your puny efforts can do to avert its fate, but it's your duty to try!

157262.name: The Galleon
157262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yarr, matey! This is a map covering four levels of a Galleon-style warship (minus the cannons, of course, since this is meant for fantasy!)

As the map doesn't detail anything other than the ship decks themselves you have the option of deciding where the ship can be found. Is it at sea, or is it docked?

If docked, perhaps your players need to sneak aboard for some reason...maybe to retrieve an artifact from the cargo hold, or to free a prisoner, or become stowaways because they simply can't afford passage to wherever they need to go. If the ship is at sea, perhaps your players are merely passengers on a ship and pirates attack? Perhaps they're looking to do a bit of piracy themselves? If so, you can print additional ships to create a ship to ship battle, all from the same file!

Whether its piracy or battling sea monsters on the high seas, if you need a ship for your adventures, this is it.
The ship itself is 140' long and 40' wide at its longest and widest points, respectively. Four different levels have been fully mapped out - The main deck, captain's quarters, crew quarters, and cargo decks. Pick which levels you need for your adventure and print away. Each section of the ship covers 6 pages in length and shouldn't take more than 15 minutes to print, cut, and tape together.

Details of the Decks:

Main Deck (1st Level) - This is the top level, with clear views of the ocean to either side. (Print pages 1-6 for just this deck)
Captain's Quarters (2nd Level) - This section maps out the captain's quarters, private quarters that are rented to individuals traveling on the ship, and the 1st Mate's quarters, as well as a private storage area for use by the captain himself or the passengers. (Print pages 7-12 for just this deck)
Crew Deck (3rd Level) - This is the crew deck. It features officers quarters for the lower ranking officers, hammocks for the sailors, a mess area, kitchen, and two storage rooms for the crew's dry goods. (Print pages 13-18 for just this deck)
Cargo Hold (4th Level) - This is the cargo hold. At the aft end of the ship there is a straw littered floor where animals are transported. At the forward end of the ship you'll find manacles, to be used when passengers or crew get rowdy and have to be jailed somewhere. And obviously, there is a lot of cargo, though there is plenty of room to add more or take away from the existing cargo as the GM sees fit. (Print pages 19-24 for just this deck)




Features:

1" = 5' Scale. At this scale, the ship measures out to 140' long at its longest point and 40' wide at its widest.
45" x 40" in actual size, though each deck of the ship only spans a mere 6 pages (45" long x 10" wide), so putting it together shouldn't take long at all!
Square, Hex, or No Grid versions. Choose which type of grid you want to use and off you go!
Full Color versions – These maps are printer intensive, full color versions of each level.
No Decoration versions - For those that wish to populate each part of the ship with their own furniture and objects, there is a stripped down, no deco version for you.
VTT Map – If you prefer to play your games online, there is an included VTT map properly sized for VTT software.

157264.name: SnuffRunners
157264.description:
User summary

SnuffRunners contains two Space Gothic adventures:


SnuffRunners is set on Terra in the Rhine-Main metropolis. The characters are sent after the disappeared daughter of a high-ranking politician. They are drawn into a maelstrom of occultism, conspiracies, madness and murder.
In Rentner vs. Raptoren (Pensioners vs. Raptors), the players take the roles of retired PTI personnel that have to battle an invasion of hungry reptiles set free by a revengeful customs inspector.


The book contains background material about the Rhine-Main region and rules for creating retired characters of ages from 60 to 96 and beyond.

157265.name: Ravenfall
157265.description:
User summary

Ravenfall is a Space Gothic adventure that takes the characters on a safari trip. While trying to protect some wannabe big-game hunters during an unexpected landing on the lost colony of Ravenfall, they unravel the planet's horrible secret.

157266.name: Wolfsbrut
157266.description:
User summary

Wolfsbrut (Wolf's breed) is a Space Gothic adventure. The characters escort a high-ranking tax collector on his mission. They cross the path of the evil order Legion 666 and their grand master Set who would use the tax money for his own dark schemes.

157267.name: Ace of Aces
157267.description:
User summary

Ace of Aces contains two Space Gothic adventures:


Ace of Aces gives the characters the "opportunity" to explore a black hole as test pilots for a new space fighter prototype. The discovery of an old Shark Investment spacecraft presents additional dangers.
In SS Collector the characters are transferred to a garbage freighter for disciplinary reasons. The smelly and boring work is interrupted by the need to blow up a rogue asteroid that threatens to crash into the space station the characters use as a base of operations. Hidden in the debris is an unexpected danger.

157268.name: Strangeworld
157268.description:
User summary

Strangeworld is a Space Gothic adventure that starts with a prize. The characters win a trip to one of the most advanced entertainment stations in the TSU. After a few days in the various theme hotels, the characters participate in true-to-life role play as knights, thieves, wizards and priests. What started as some fantastical fun quickly gets serious as the characters are drawn into a murderous scheme.

157269.name: In Hoc  Signo Vinces
157269.description:
User summary

In Hoc Signo Vinces is a Space Gothic source book detailing the Order of Crusaders. It includes:


History of the order
Organization
Equipment
The flagship Herman von Salza
A typical cloister
Important NPCs
An adventure module for crusader characters
New and expanded character classes

157270.name: Squid Swimmer
157270.description:
User Summary

You are a giant squid, but your spaceship crashed on a strange planet. You constantly swim forward and can click to move up and fight against gravity. If you hit the top of the screen, the bottom of the screen or a giant rectangle you lose. Swim as long as you can to earn the best score. You can also run into krill to eat them and further increase your score.

157271.name: Elite Base Jump
157271.description:
User Summary

Test your reaction speed in this game. Follow the countdown, and on go jump from the platform. You must also deploy your parachute. Deploying to early and you won't hit the ground early enough to continue. Deploy to late and you will sustain damage. Damage is cumulative and you can sustain too much damage on a single drop to live. Play as long as you can and earn points for each round you do well enough in. Don't be the last to hit the ground or you will be eliminated.

157272.name: Dungeons & Dragons Fantasiaroolipeli hahmolomakkeita
157272.description:
user summary

Tässä paketissa on 36 hahmolomaketta, joita voit käyttää D&D Fantasiaroolipelissä

D&D character sheets 36 pieces

157273.name: The Gunsmith
157273.description:
User Summary

Kill all the enemies you see while moving to the right. You can shoot enemies with your rifle, shotgun or blow them up with dynamite. But take care, your ammunition is limited. You can jump and move from left to right. If you run out of ammo you can use a knife to attack.

157274.name: -pong-
157274.description:
User Summary

Move your paddle and hit the ball. Try to get the ball past the opponents paddle. Play against a friend or against the AI. Your paddle is on one side of the screen and your opponents is on the other. You can move your paddle up or down. The ball speeds up each time it is hit. Watch out, the ball can curve irrespective of how the ball is hit! Additional changes of angle appear beyond how the ball is hit.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Supplement Nominee
157275.name: Collectors Battlefield Wargaming System: D-Day – Battle of Carentan
157275.description:
This is the first module of the Collector's Battlefield Wargaming System, a 'turn key' quick play set of rules with a full line of 28mm prepainted figures and vehicle.

CB: Carentan is a skirmish level miniatures wargame- that is, it represents combat at its most basic level of fighting: man to man.

CB:Carentan puts the player in the role of an infantry squad or platoon leader. Firefights break out in 'mad minutes', followed by lulls where the player exercises leadership by rallying troops, bringing in reserves, and maneuvering his troops to set up for the next firefight. Firefights center on the machine gun- placement of your MG42's and .30cals are crucial to glorious success or ignominious defeat!

Scale:
1 figure = 1 soldier or vehicle
1 inch = 2 yards
1 turn = approximately 30 seconds
Combat Lull = 2 to 10 minutes.

Keeping track of units stats is made easy with quick reference cards included with every pack, detailing the capabilities of every squad, leader, heavy weapon and vehicle. Squad level games are fast and furious, taking about 60 minutes to an hour and half.

157276.name: Bridge Bomber Bus
157276.description:
User Summary

Drivin on a bus, running people over, shooting tanks and helicopters, just drivin on my bus.

In Bridge Bomber Bus you try to do as much destruction as you can. You can drive over people or shoot them with rockets. Bigger enemies like tanks and helicopters you won't be able to destroy by driving them over, you will have to shot them with your rockets. But be careful, tanks can shoot you back and take two rockets to destroy.

157277.name: Alien Abduction II
157277.description:
User Summary

Fly a UFO and collect people in your tractor beam, but don't let MIB agents take your photo! You can also beam up heavy object to drop on helicopters and tanks that oppose you, or on MIB agents that have taken your photo. Collect enough people to pass the level and move onto the next.

157278.description:
Card game in which each player is a gardener who tries to get the best variety of flowers to grow in his garden.

There are flower cards and accessory cards, such as seeds, sunshine, water etc. Different kinds of flowers need different combinations of accessories and yield different point values.

The active player can draw cards, trade cards with open cards on the table, plant flowers and trade with the other players. The first player to plant ten points worth of flowers is the winner.
157278.name: Blumenzüchter

157279.name: Turnier der Magier
157279.description:
The forces of light and dark are running a tournament, with the winner ruling the earth for the next 100 years.

The game consists of cards showing magicians, spells, items and missions. Each player has a magician card with a special ability, and a mission card with another special activity. The active player can play cards with spells or items and use the abilities of his/her magician/mission cards. Other players can interfere with counterspells or special items. The goal is to gain three tokens, either individually (in a 2 or 3 player game) or as a team (in a 4 player game). The first player or team who gets the 3 tokens is the winner.

157280.name: Dragon Fist 3: Age of the Warrior
157280.description:
User Summary

Fight against the AI or a local friend. You can block punch kick or use weapons. Or combine moves for special combinations moves. Choose from over thirty characters.

157281.name: Bloody Blades
157281.description:
User Summary

Kill as many evil ninjas as you can, before they kill you. You can attack with your blade, use your speed move to go really fast, and you can block. Gravity has no hold on you as you fly through the forest at tremendous speed. Get as many points as you can.

157282.name: Dyson's Delves II
157282.description:
From publisher blurb:


Customize your dungeons!

More adventures and maps set under the earth for old-school fantasy roleplaying games (OSR games).

Dyson's Delves contains over 140 pages of maps and adventures featuring the unique mapping style of Dyson Logos.

Seven full adventures fill out the beginning of the book, followed by 44 additional dungeon maps each with a page for the GM to key and make notes about each dungeon.

The adventures in this volume are:

Trouble at Imp Brucke - strange goblins and stranger things challenge characters of levels 6-7
The Screams From Jedder's Hole - something has started screaming from under the main temple in town in this adventure for levels 4-5
Cavanaugh's Hall - a small site-based encounter around old ruins for levels 7-8
The Ruins of Corvel on the Mount - a science-fantasy delve for levels 6-7
Goblin Gully - a true classic adventure with one hell of a final bite for levels 1-2
Atarin's Delve - a dungeon turned into the headquarters of a team of unusual bandits for level 4
Valley of the Red Apes - a collection of 5 smaller site-based encounter / adventures set in a valley overrun with carnivorous red apes including:
Ziggurat of Rhissel the Morning Lord (level 6-8)
The Secret of Jen's Hall (level 5-6)
The Cliffside Stronghold (level 5-7)
A Devourer Most Foul (level 5-7)
The Silver Obelisk





Each map in the second portion of the book is presented on it’s own page opposite a lined page that you use to indicate where the dungeon in question is, what it is known as on your campaign map, as well as what is important about it in your games.

This book is designed at 6x9 layout, not letter - which means it uses single-column text which entails easier reading on electronic devices.

157283.name: The Shrine of St. Aleena
157283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ages ago, in a much simpler time, a young boy embarked upon his very first epic adventure. A dungeon was entered, a friend was made, monsters were fought, and a friend was lost. This is that boy's tribute to the memory of his long forgotten friend. . .

The Shrine of St. Aleena is a Labyrinth Lord adventure designed for 3-6 characters of 1st-3rd level (about 12 levels total). A diverse range of classes is recommended, however, at least one character should be of Lawful alignment. The Shrine of St. Aleena involves a mixture of roleplaying, problem solving, and dungeon crawling. The adventure takes place in a cave complex known as the Shrine of St. Aleena which is set in the Chronicles of Amherth™ campaign setting, but may easily be dropped into any remote wilderness region of any campaign world.

Note: In true old school fashion, a number of the encounters in The Shrine of St. Aleena involve save or die-type mechanics. The Labyrinth Lord is free to alter these effects for groups who prefer less random mortality.

157284.name: The Invasion of the Halloween-Monsters
157284.description:
User Summary

The Halloween monsters have come to steal all the candy. Luckily you have a gravity gun to destroy them. Pick up the monsters and fling them around to kill them and take the candy back. Bats can't be hit by the gravity gun, so you have to throw something into them. Rip the heads or limbs off of zombies.

157285.name: Leech
157285.description:
User Summary

You are a leech. Suck on legs and feet as they go by. But don't take too much blood or you will explode. You will also die if you don't fill the blood meter before the time is up. Avoid bandages and bony parts of the foot. Open wounds are a special delicacy.

157286.name: Monster Schreck
157286.description:
The players are monsters and have to escape from the monster hunters. This is achieved by elimination: Every monster which gathers 7 or more hunter points is out of the game. Last monster standing is the winner.
Each player has a monster card and draws two action cards into his/her hands, then three hunter cards which are placed openly in front of him/her. Now each player can play action cards on two of the hunters and the monster card can attack the third one. Some action cards can take hunters out of the game while others can redirect them to other players (there is no defense against this). When all actions are resolved, the player with most hunter points has to keep the highest hunter card. When after a few rounds the number of hunter points a player has gathered exceeds 7, that player is out. The others continue untili only one monster is left.

157287.name: Tactico!
157287.description:
The game is played on a board with 16 numbered chips face down in three rows. The objective is to force your opponent to remove the last chip on the board. Players take turns removing up to 4 chips from any one row until only one chip is left. The player who removes the last chip scores the value on that chip. The first player to accumulate 30 or more point loses the game.

From the game box: Fast-paced family game is easy to play, tricky to win! Payers must count, strategize & think ahead!

157288.name: Aztec Conquest
157288.description:
The game is played on a board 10 squares by 9. Each player has 9 pieces which being placed side by side in two lines along one diagonal. The objective is to be the first player to move their 9 pieces into a 3 by 3 square in their corner of the game board.

From the game box: Slide carefully along the ground to the sacred Aztec temple ... Keep and eye on your enemy, overcome obstacles, and make sure all the members of your tribe reach the safety of the temple.

1. Assemble the Aztec warriors in diagonal formation along the center of the board according to tribal colors.
2. Slide a warrior along a row or column until he encounters a boundary or another warrior.
3. Plan the best route, slide the warriors forward and help them enter the sacred temple.
4. Be the first player to slide his/her entire tribe of nine Aztec warriors into the temple ... and WIN!

157289.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 206 - 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit
Good, the Bad and the Ugly
When the Battle is Not on a Field
rpgissueversion: I Got Nowhere Else to Go!
157289.description:
"I Got Nowhere to Go!"
Cover by The Fraim Brothers

157290.name: Tipping Point
157290.description:
An immersive, photorealistic adventure game that stimulates both sides of your brain. As you solve a myriad of challenging puzzles, you’re rewarded with a satisfying story filled with drama, humor and unexpected plot twists. Original music, lifelike characters and scenery create a cinematic experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

User Summary
Tipping Point is a click adventure game in which you must solve sequential problems by selecting and using items in each frame in order to advance to the next frame. Puzzles involve such things as the mundane - phoning a customer service hot line - to the bizarre - luring a African crane off of your lap with a chip so you can reach the remote control for the television.

157291.name: Alpaca Pakapaka
157291.description:
Translated intro from the game manual:

An alpaca contest will be held. Breeders from across the country will compete to see who has the most beautiful alpaca. Scoring is determined by fashion sense and length of neck. To be victorious, please grow a beautiful alpaca! Let's grow a more beautiful opponent than our opponent! Negotiate with other players to collect accessories.

157292.name: Laura in the Magic Forest Card Game
157292.description:
YOU are an apprentice witch. You can procure magic from a variety of forest resources. You can create magic called "mug", and use it to carry out the extraction of "Mana" - the energy of nature. Who can hold the most excellent performance?! Please be careful so as not to get in the way of resource procurement earnestly. It is a card game that anyone can play easily!

- From the Magic Forest and Black Cat Rola

This card game uses trick taking mechanics. The suit color of the card winning each trick becomes the trump suit of the next trick. Cards earned become magical resources and can be combined to score bonus points.

157293.name: Liar Kingdom
157293.description:
Translated from description on publisher's website.

This is Liar Kingdom. Funny people lie for the good of the kingdom, but the poor citizens despise them for their lies. YOU are the authority of darkness, dominate in the shadows of this crazy kingdom. Even the king is afraid of you. Nobles and slaves alike will die not even know your existence. You are invincible and your power is absolute, but one question has been asked that might change the kingdom's fate:
"Who among the kingdom's people has the most power?"
Using only three cards and three "declaration chips," play a game to earn victory points faster than your opponents.

Each player plays one of their three cards face down and one of their three chips face up on top of the card. The face up chip can be the true identity of their played card or a lie to try to trick the other players into believing what they are playing. There is an optional round where players can change the chip on their card to a different one. Then the cards are revealed and the way they interact decides who won the round and receives VP. Also, if you were lying or telling the truth with your chip determines if you receive or lose additional VP.

Designer's summary:
暗殺者、王様、奴隷のカードを１枚ずつ持ってゲームをします。プレイヤーは順番に手番を行います。自分の出すカードがどれかをチップを出して宣言する。任意のカードを裏向きで出す。全員がそれを行ったら勝敗の判定を行います。自分の出したカードが次のとおりだった場合、勝利します。暗殺者を出して王様がいた場合、それを１人敗北させて勝利します。王様を出して自分を殺す暗殺者がいなかった場合、奴隷を全員敗北させて勝利します。奴隷を出して王様がいなかった場合に勝利します。勝利したプレイヤーは得点を獲得します。勝利しなかったプレイヤーは全員敗北。宣言と異なるカードを出していたプレイヤーはマイナス点を獲得します。誰かが８点以上を獲得するとゲーム終了。得点の高いプレイヤーの勝利です。

Each player has 3 cards and 3 tokens, each of which represents Royalty, Assassin, and Slave. Starting player declares a card he will be playing by placing corresponding token face-up, then plays one card face-down. He may lie about the card he's playing. Then next player does the same, and so on. When all players are done, reveal all cards they played and resolve the outcome. If one or more Royalties are in play, each Assassin in play kills one of them. Successful Assassins win the round. After the assassination, if one or more Royalties are still in play, survived Royalties win the round, otherwise all Slaves win the round. Winners get points, and players who have lied and still didn't win the round lose points. A game ends when a player gains total of 8 points. A player with the most points wins the game.

157294.description:
Cat 10 is a cute cat card game with easy rules in which you try to create the perfect cat hand! During the game, players reveal numbered cat cards and tally their sum, trying to get as close to 10 as possible. When your score equals seven or higher, you have a choice to make:


You can change your goal to shoot for a target of 20 instead of 10 and keep revealing cat cards.
You can score for the cards currently face up before you.
You can discard the most recently revealed card to roll the dice and try to steal another player's score while simultaneously risking yours.
157294.name: Cat 10

157295.name: Music Stomp
157295.description:
User Summary

You try to avoid getting smashed. Pillars fall from the top of the screen corresponding with the beat. A pillar that will fall soon slightly drops prior to falling so you have a chance to avoid it. The longer you last the higher your score.

157296.name: Execution Corner
157296.description:
from the Introduction:
This is a first in a series of locales to drop into your game. Execution Corner is a crossroads location where criminals are hung. You’ll find the hangman living close by to tend to the gallows. It is also a frequently traveled road and thirsty travelers stop at the No Tomorrow Tavern. But it is no secret, hanging days are when the tavern collects the most coin.

Designer's Summary for the Revised Version:

Execution Corner was my first micro-location before I even started doing this. I wanted to go back and tweak it a little. I cleaned up the map a bit and edited the text.

I like this location. I borrow a lot from folklore and superstition. Plus the horror of not so much the execution, but the festivities that surround it. And I gotta say, I really do love my pissing wall.

User Summary for Revised Version:

A Micro Location published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

157297.name: Music Zap
157297.description:
User Summary

Avoid the lasers. The lasers pulse with the beat of the music and you must avoid them. Every time you get hit by a laser beam you lose a life. The longer you last the more points you earn.

157298.name: Squarit
157298.description:
Squarit is a played on a board containing 16 squares each surrounded by four spaces for tiles, with each pair of adjacent squares sharing one tile space. Each tile space has a specific tile that can be placed on it. The squares are numbered from 4-64 by fours. The edges of the board are also numbered, from 1-4.

The game can be played in two ways. In the aptly-named "Game of Chance" two to five players take turns drawing a tile and placing it on its designated space. The player placing the fourth tile around a square scores the value of the square multiplied by the value of the edge of the board corresponding to the played tile.

The "Game of Skill" is for two players. The scoring rule is the same, but here each player starts with half the blocks and can choose which one to play, generally speaking. If three sides of a block have been played this forces the fourth side to be played as soon as possible, and if that is the third tile for another square it forces that fourth tile immediately, etc.

The designer patented the game some years before publishing it.

Note that the board shown in the patent is not exactly the same as the published version, as the rules state the squares in each quarter of the board sum to 136.

157300.name: Hadron
157300.description:
From the Manual

Remember the silly Viking missions that took soil samples to detect life on Mars and missed the big rock shaped aliens? Well, now we're at war with those oversized pet rocks. They've managed to terrorize space with a strange assortment of ships, creatures and weird asteroids. Hop in your cruiser and show them who's boss in this solar system.

The object (besides having fun) is to follow the fighters back to their base and destroy it. If you successfully vaporize the base, you will be refueled, supplied with more ammunition and returned to open space at the next higher level of difficulty. When you reach the next level you must again pursue the enemy fighters back to their base.

157301.name: Game of Defense: Pacific
157301.description:
Game of Defense: Pacific is a light wargame. It is for two sides (U.S. and "Asiatic"), each of whom has five ships each of three types (battleships, cruisers, and submarines). The ships are deployed on a map of the Pacific with a grid divided into red and white squares.

On a turn a player moves one piece (or possibly more than one, as the rules are a bit unclear). Battleships and cruisers can move several squares on a turn but are restricted to squares of a particular color. Submarines only move one square a turn but can use either color. Submarines capture enemy ships by landing on them, but the larger ships capture by jumping.

Each side starts the game by mining ten squares on their shores; when an enemy ship crosses such a square a card is drawn which may have a bad effect.

Each side has four objective cards which they randomly select one of at the start of the game, keeping it hidden from the opponent(s). The game is won by the side achieving its objective first.

The game can be played by more than two players by dividing one or both sides between players.

157302.name: Minimal Space Combat
157302.description:
Minimal Space Combat is a game of tactical space ship battle. The players design ships and then can battle to the death. It may be used with any scifi background as it has a very minimal theme. Players plot movement and then move simultaneously. Combat can occur at any time during movement when opposing ships are in range and in the weapons firing arc. The goal is simply to destroy the other player's ships.

Timothy Swenson describes the reasoning for designing this game as follows:
"The premise behind this game is this: what is the simplest playable game possible to game tactical space combat. The game must make some reasonable attempt to come close to simulating space combat and not just the simplest possible game. The emphasis in this game is fast and easy. Playability is given more consideration than realism. There is no consideration for expansion of these rules, because then it would not be minimal. Use the game for those times when you want a quick and dirty space combat game or for introducing someone new to gaming."

In addition to the basic game Timothy also has minimal rules for a campaign game, a method for playing solo and a tutorial for introducing new players to space combat games.

157303.description:
SeaDogs is a fast paced family game for 2-6 players, ages 10 and up. Players take on the rolls of Pirate captains taking part in a competition to gather the most Gold and Treasure. The Captain with the most Gold after all is said and done is the victor.

Sail into a port, and get gold by selling any cargo you have earned from your acts of piracy. Pillage ports to gain cargo, but once a pirate pillages a port they must move to another Port to take any more actions.

There is no honor among Pirates, and it's every Captain for themselves on the high seas. Players may attack each other and steal Cargo, Gold, or even Treasure that has been found on mysterious islands in the area. Pirates who take plunder from other players get a Bounty on their heads that goes to the next Pirate to take them down a peg or two.

Sea Dogs has a whimsical style. The world it takes place in is populated by animals. The base game focuses on dogs, but who knows what other animals are out there.

SeaDogs is a quick playing game that is fun for kids and adults. And it is designed to be kid friendly so everyone has a chance of winning, while still having enough depth that adults can play together and enjoy it as well.
157303.name: SeaDogs

157304.name: Katsu Curry?! This is not the time for that!
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
157304.description: It is currently an era of worldwide economic deflation. The politicians of your country seek to understand the common people. Players become the leaders of an opposition party who have taken it upon themselves to reestablish economic responsibility. Each player will bid to enforce a "fair and folksy" price of a variety of goods and services. Each time a player sets a price, they will earn honor points. The winner, and new political leader, is the player who earns the most points.

157305.name: Hired Gun
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
157305.description:
From the publisher's website:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization and Signature Ability Decks, available through Print on Demand, provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You’ll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe.

The Hired Gun Signature Ability Deck keeps the text of your Hired Gun’s Signature Abilities close at hand, allowing you to use them swiftly, rather than pause at critical junctures to look them up.

Each Specialization and Signature Ability Deck contains:

2 cover cards (including a reference guide for each deck)
20 standard sized talent cards

157306.name: Hired Gun Heavy
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
157306.description:
From the publisher's website:

Star Wars®: Edge of the Empire™ Specialization Decks, available through Print on Demand, provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. New and experienced players alike will appreciate these handy reference cards, and GMs will love being able to keep the action moving. You’ll have the text of your talents at your fingertips, leaving you free to focus on the challenges at hand, while art for each talent immerses you even further into the Star Wars universe.

The Heavy Specialization Deck keeps the text of your Heavy’s talents close at hand, allowing you to use them swiftly, rather than pause at critical junctures to look them up.

Each Specialization Deck contains:

2 cover cards (including a reference guide for each deck)
20 standard sized talent cards

Each Signature Deck contains:

2 cover cards (including a reference guide for each deck)
18 standard sized talent cards (Split into two groups of 9.)

157310.name: Explorer Driver
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks
157310.description:
From the publisher's website:

Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks, available through Print on Demand, provide GMs and players with a fun and easy way to manage character and NPC talents at the gaming table. rpgseries: Star Wars Edge of the Empire Specialization Decks

The Archaeologist Specialization Deck keeps the text of your Archaeologist’s talents close at hand, allowing you to use them swiftly, rather than pause at critical junctures to look them up.

Each Specialization Deck contains:

2 cover cards (including a reference guide for each deck)
20 standard sized talent cards

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
157313.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly set in Landshut, a German city in the Bavarian region.
157313.name: Monopoly: Landshut Edition

157314.description: Silent Operative adds MERCS from the FCC House 9 faction to MERCS: Recon. Included are five House 9 MERCS and their corresponding player boards and special rules. In addition, the mission pack contains new missions and a new tile.
157314.name: MERCS: Recon – Silent Operative

157315.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Baden-Baden", in the Southwest of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157315.name: Das Baden-Baden Spiel

157316.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Münster", in the West of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157316.name: Das Münster-Spiel

157317.name: DICE Brewing
157317.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN DEVELOPMENT




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.





User Summary
It is a unique game in witch you magage resources and brew beer using innovative device DICE+ in fun way.Probably you are wondering what is DICE Brewing and where to begin our joint adventure, and what challenges come to measure all the players in the game.

It's a mobile game based on unique DICE+ device. What is important, DICE Brewing is about brewing beer, according to players own recipes.

DICE Brewing players take on the role of young brewers who decide which beer they intend to brew. The use of different combinations of light and dark malts and hops gives you the opportunity to discover close to 25 recipes, maintained in his characteristic style and climate.

Of course, each recipe has a different level of complexity and requires special skills, gradually gained in our brewery. But that's not all. Our young brewers gain their knowledge and skills, using a special device - DICE+, which is a tool that will help develop the ingredients, or brew and serve beer. This is definitely an indispensable tool of every young brewer at the DICE Brewing brewery.

Through numerous mini-games, continuous exercise, as well as subsequent brewing beer, all adepts and players earn championship points, and the person, which collect the most number of them in the game, will win and receives honorable title of Master of Brewing.

157318.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Cologne", in the West of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157318.name: Das Köln-Spiel

157319.description:

According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157319.name: Das Mannheim Spiel

157320.name: Universal Path Abilities II
157320.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 16th in our new series of Mythic Minis, Universal Path Abilities II brings you 8 brand-new mythic path abilities for the Archmage path, from Planar Savant and Contingency Plan to Dramatic Reveal and Eternal Youth!

157321.name: The Familiars of Black Japan
157321.description:
From publisher blurb:

Black Japan is a weird setting, and even the familiars owned by its spell casters tend to be a little strange. Living garage-kit models, lewd fairies, pitiful child-ghosts and even living tendrils made of animated feces are available familiar options. The new familiars presented here are fairly common among Black Tokyo’s spellcasters. In many cases, these statistics can be used for normal creatures as well.

157322.description:
Dice Brewing is a dice-building game in which you manage resources and brew beer to become the beer master.
The players become brewers whose goal is to acquire the resources needed to brew many new beer recipes and then gaining the rewards that come with brewing them - gold and mastery points. To do so, each player uses their player board and two location cards (marketplace and black market) to develop their resource pool and stock their storage with certain tokens that alter the course of the game. The player who has the most mastery points at the end, wins the game.
Players will have to prove themselves by brewing various styles of beer, acquiring specific malts and hops, as well as enhancing the recipes with ingredients that will make your beers stand out. But that's not all... The Apprentices will be able to compete with each other directly, making their lives harder by using some unrefined methods!

Players manage their resources by way of 6-sided dice in 4 different colors:


Light malt: yellow dice
Dark malt: black dice
Hops: green dice
Skill: blue dice, which allow for additional effects on recipe cards and resource dice.


Players can influence the luck of the dice through a variety of cards that allow them to replace the dice, increase the value rolled, receive extra dice, buy special ingredient tokens, and buy action tokens - which can affect opponents or provide additional dice manipulation.

When a player collects the correct number of dice with the proper value, he can brew one of the available recipes and gain points, gold, or another effect. Players can also enhance recipes by throwing in additional ingredients to earn a bonus (more gold, more points).
157322.name: Dice Brewing
boardgameexpansion: Dice Brewing: Mr. Hop in Essen
Dice Brewing: Red Moon Pale Ale
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 34-Look Ma! Top of the World!!
Podcast #080 - Five in Your Face
The Spiel #207 - Cubism

157323.description:
From GMT P500:

MBT is a complete game system modeling the US 7th Army and the GSFG Soviet mechanized forces of 1987. It is M1 Abrams (105mm and 120mm armed version)versus a whole stable of Soviet armor with their T-80s, T-72s, T-64s, and upgraded models of T-62 and T-55. There is even M60A3s sprinkled in to balance out the US tank inventory. Bradley IFVs and CFVs mechanized units are set to take on their counterparts mounted in BMP 1,2s and even a few 3s. Not to overlooked M113A2s and BTRs and MT-LBs are also set to make their appearance.

Mechanized infantry and their related weapons are in abundance, including M47 Dragon, M72 LAW, AT-7 Saxon, AT-4 Spigot, and multiple RPG versions.

The scale is right down in the weeds with individual vehicles, infantry squads, half squads and sections. Each hex is just 100 meters across, so it is going to be nose-to-nose action at its finest.

The rules cover the total realm of modern mechanized combat with ATGMs, including TOW and deadly Soviet gun launched missiles like the AT-11 Sniper and AT-8 Songster, special armor (including ERA), advanced night fighting with thermal images and image intensifiers, advance artillery with ICM and laser guided shells, helicopters, including the AH-64A Apache and Mi-24P Hind-F, attack aircraft, including the A-10A Warthog and SU-25 Frogfoot, and missile and gun armed AA units to counter the deadly air threats. It is all included in this total package.
157323.name: MBT (second edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 55: Jim Day

157325.name: Agram’s Temple
157325.description:
user summary:
A short Dungeon World adventure.

user summary:
A tomb looting spree with a unique guardian. Small map, location key, unique monster definition, and treasure list.

157326.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Stuttgart", in the Southwest of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157326.name: Das Stuttgart Spiel

157327.name: Madeira: The Ambassadors
157327.description: As the economy of Madeira flourishes, the guilds are expanding and sending ambassadors to distant countries to strengthen their influence. Madeira: The Ambassadors enriches the game with four new guild favors that are all related to the colonies, bringing new strategies to interacting with them.

157328.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Würzburg", in the South of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. 157329.description:

157330.description:

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000.
