157331.description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of "Osnabrück", in the Northwest of Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
157331.name: Das Osnabrück-Spiel

157332.name: Steinerne Schwingen
157332.description:
(from the back of the book)
At night they prowl in the streets of the city. During daytime they sit quietly and watch the good citizens of Gareth from roofs, walls and gutters, disguised as inanimate statues, gargoyles. But where do the stone guardians of the city come from? What are their goals, and the nature of their connection to strange alleys of the imperial city, which are commonly known as Neverroads? And why is the party followed by a mysterious stone girl?

Your heroes will find answers to all these questions in this adventure. They will discover an ancient secret of Gareth, that dark powers would be happy to get, for it holds the key to death and destruction.

157333.description: Mage Wars: Forged in Fire introduces two alternate Mages with unique abilities — the Adramelech Warlock and the Warlord of the Anvil Throne — to Mage Wars, and it includes multiple copies of the 41 new spells featured in this set, such as the legendary "Sersiryx" and the "Harshforge Monolith".
157333.name: Mage Wars: Forged in Fire – Spell Tome Expansion

157334.name: Amor und die Herzen
157334.description:
The goal of the game is to shoot the heart of the opponent with Amor's arrow. The game pieces are the heart, Amor, the devil, 3 male guardian hearts, 7 female guardian hearts and 2 impetuous hearts. They are used to protect the player's heart and impede the opponent's Amor. To do this, the pieces can move in specific ways (like in Chess) and can block or eliminate one another. The devil is the only piece, that can eliminate Amor. When Amor gets in a straight line with another's heart, he can shoot it and wins the game. The game can be played by 2 or 4 players. In the game for 4 players, the players at the opposite sides of the game board play against one another.

The Game was most likely published in the 1920s.

157335.name: Dragon Reign
157335.description:
subtitle:
A Dungeons & Dragons game using the One-Roll Engine

from the colophon:
To utilise the material contained herein, you must own a copy of Reign and the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook.

from the Foreward[sic]:
The material you now have in your possession is what I call a “patch” for REIGN: by following the guidelines herein, you should be able to play Dungeons & Dragons using the excellent One-Roll Engine.

from The ORE Reivisited:
The REIGN ‘flavour’ of the One-Roll Engine has been altered to reflect the heroic fantasy setting of Dungeons and Dragons.

from Skills Re-visited:
The skills in Reign are very specific to that setting: Dungeons & Dragons has little need for a Plead skill. Conversely, there are a lot more skills in D & D than the former game which are somewhat irrelevant.

from Spell Conversion Notes:
Spells in Dungeons & Dragons are radically different to those found in REIGN. As it is the D & D flavour we’re trying to capture in this conversion, we need to make some adjustments.

user note:
A spell conversion guide is provided to translate the spell effects from the D&D stats into ORE stats.

Although the conversions rule require the use of the Reign core rulebook and the D&D 3.5 Players handbook, the rules in this book are not compatible with either of those games, except as used together with the modifications contained in this conversion guide. The Reign rules are altered to conform to the tropes of D&D, and the D&D material is altered to use the modified One-Roll Engine mechanics.

157337.name: Weine nicht! Scherz-Roulette
157337.description:
A thrilling race between a skilled motorist, a jealous pedestrian and a beautiful girl: Each player has 3 meeples: a car, a girl and a man. The goal is to get all 3 meeples around the game board and back into their own garage. The opposite players move in opposite directions. The moves of the meeples are determined by a spinner. Whenever the different kinds of meeples meet, different things happen. The girl enters every car it meets and may change cars if the oportunity arrives. The man gets every girl to leave the car. If a car with a girl of another color enters its garage, the girl has to begin anew. The spinner can send the car or the girl back to its starting point too, if it shows "Weine nicht" (= don't cry).

This game was published in the 1920s or 1930s.

157338.name: With a Bullet
157338.description:
from the cover:
An Adventure for Gun-Fu: Balletic Ballistics

from the foreword:
With A Bullet is a Gun-Fu adventure for 5th-level heroes. You'll need the Gun-Fu: Balletic Ballistics game in order to make perfect sense of everything in here …

This adventure features six primary encounters, several of which can occur in any order (or not at all). … the adventure is flexible enough to accommodate multiple scenarios. … This is not a location-based adventure, so you won't find detailed maps or keyed descriptions. A Gun-Fu game is more concerned with drama and vast amounts of ordinance, anyway, right?

from the Introduction:

Boss Tanaka is not a man who minces his words. His deal is offered in simple, direct terms. "My man in Lombok is Tony Ashgar. Once you're through customs, get a cab to his bar, the Highlight. All the airport cabbies know it. Tony'll pay you there."

157339.name: Viktory: Terror in Europe
157339.description:
Fast-Paced Strategy Game that Allows You to Play as a Terrorist Setting Bombs Off in Europe or Operatives Trying to Stop Him...

A terrorist is wreaking havoc in Europe. Every time the terrorist leaves a city there is the possibility he has left a bomb, trap, or recruiting cell. If Interpol does not find the bomb before it detonates, then the terrorist makes progress toward his goal of instilling fear across Europe.

The job of Interpol is to coordinate the efforts of Secret Agents, Bomb Squad, Special Forces, and an Informant Network to stop the terrorist from accomplishing his goal. It will take the combined special abilities of each Operative and the Informant Network for Interpol to win.

During the game, one player plays as the terrorist and tries to elude the operatives chasing him. With hidden movement cards, traps, bombs and recruiting cells to use, he tries to outmaneuver his opponents and stay one step ahead of them. The operatives goal is to catch the terrorist and defeat him in combat. Along the way, they want to avoid traps, defuse bombs, and defeat any recruiting cells the terrorist puts in their way. But the operatives have to be careful. If they get too spread out, the terrorist might attack and defeat them while they are isolated.

157340.name: Dungeon Delvers
157340.description:
webpage blurb:
Dungeon Delvers is an ultra-portable one-page D&D variant.

It packs a lot into one page: rules for attacks and saves, 4 classes, 3 races, spells, healing, conditions, and monsters. The system uses only a d6. There's even a rock-paper-scissors system for rolling a d6!

System Overview

All rolls are 1d6. Roll 1d6 each for the 6 classic abilities. Attack rolls succeed on 5-6. All other rolls are ability rolls, which succeed if they roll less than or equal to the relevant ability. Ability rolls are used both as skill checks and as saves.

Fighters deal extra hits per level, rogues get a bonus on ability rolls, wizards get one spell per level to use at-will, and clerics can cast any one spell of their choice once per day (more at higher levels).

The game package includes:


A two-page PDF containing the rules on one page, and an expanded spell list on the second page. The spell list includes spells for wizards and clerics levels 1 through 3 (that's a lot of play time).
A one-page PocketMod PDF of the rules that can be printed and folded into a booklet that will fit in your pocket.
An .azw3 file containing the rules and expanded spell list, for use on newer Kindles.
A .mobi file containing the rules and expanded spell list, for use on older Kindles.
An .epub file containing the rules and expanded spell list, for use on iPads and other eReaders.

157341.name: Iron Tsar
157341.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Iron Tsar Series Pitch, engineers battle zombies in the imperial court of an alternate-universe magical Russia, as envisaged by ASH LAW (The Reliquary).

157342.name: 101 Cargos (Second Edition)
rpgpublisher: BITS UK Ltd (British Isles Traveller Support)
157342.description:
From the rear cover:

A supplement for Marc Miller's Traveller

101 Cargos…
…a series of cargos to liven up your interstellar trading.
1001 Plots…
…an almost infinite range of adventure links for any cargo…
Cargo Codes…
…hazards, special handling instructions - all those things the players ought to know…
Cargo Generation…
…complete tables for generating various cargo types for shipment and speculative trading…

157343.name: Village of Troubles
157343.description:
from How to use the Village:
This scenario provides seven micro-encounters to use with Dungeon Delvers. Feel free to use them singly in any village, or together to stop the cult of the Devourer, at least for now.

Encounters were designed with 4 PCs in mind, but difficulty/opposition can be adjusted up or down if needed.

The encounters in this village were inspired by Scott (AngryDM) Rehm’s village map as posted on Google+.

user note:
The map is not included but a link to the file is provided.

157344.name: Escape (1985)
157344.description:
User Summary

In 2045 the United States of America has been torn apart by civil war and foreign attacks. You must get to your home of Turtalia, A new growing democratic nation, from the oppressive police state of Dorado with important information.

“Escape” is based on the “Choose Your Own Adventure” book of the same name.

157345.name: Phileas Fogg & Co
157345.description:
In Phileas Fogg & Co up to four players bet on Fogg's attempt to travel around the world in 80 days. All players determine the speed of the journey by plaing cards. You win, if Fogg and his companions move according to your role. The own role is kept secret and can be changed. There are four different roles: Phileas Fogg wants to arrive exactly in time, Passepartout wants to arrive as soon as possible, detective Fix wants to arrive as late as possible, Jules Vernes is interested in an exciting race.

The game is part of a scientific publication about Jules Verne's Around the World in 80 Days. The box contains the game and a book with 80 essays on Verne's novel. The name of the whole box is: Weltnetzwerke – Weltspiele. Ein Buch und ein Spiel zu Jules Vernes 'In 80 Tagen um die Welt, edited by Passepartout, Konstanz 2013.

157346.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Dossier: Plotting Cthulhu
157346.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 19 page Plotting Cthulhu Dossier helps you construct some truly nefarious Mythos plots set against the backdrop of World War Two. By looking at various inspirational film and television sources it hopes to show how you, the Keeper, can mine them for ideas for your own games. If you are still a bit stumped, there is a comprehensive plot generator to further aid you in your machinations plus a two page spread of the Achtung! Cthulhu Secret War map.

Keeper's can use the plot generator tables in part or as a whole to give you the structure of your mind-shattering adventures. You can roll your way through the entire plot, taking advantage of the almost limitless variations, or just check one or more tables for inspiration when you are stuck. Dip in for a mysterious location, a villain, creautre, artefact, or much, much more.

THIS IS A SYSTEMLESS PRODUCT - USABLE WITH ANY ROLEPLAYING GAME.

Originally designed for: Achtung! Cthulhu - a terrifying World War Two setting, fully compatible with the Call of Cthulhu, Sixth Edition and Savage Worlds roleplaying games.

157347.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Dossier: Secret War Documents
157347.description:
From publisher blurb:

No wartime Keeper or GM should be without these form-fillable secret documents, orders and telegrams for both Allied and Axis forces. Includes seven types of Allied and Third Reich telegrams as well as generic Top Secret, Black Sun, Nachtwolfe, Section M, Majestic and Third Reich documents.

Bring your adventures to thrilling life today!

Originally designed for: Achtung! Cthulhu - a terrifying World War Two setting, fully compatible with the Call of Cthulhu, Sixth Edition and Savage Worlds roleplaying games.

157348.name: Realm of the Rat King
157348.description:
from the Introduction:
When the rats swarmed out of the woods and through the village of Roarke, nobody paid much attention. But when they swarmed through Trent and Yarah only a few days later, the locals knew something foul was afoot.
Survivors describe the event as though a wave of rats crested at one end of the village and rolled all the way to the other. Along their chosen path they would enter every building by door, window, or chimney, seeking any small shiny object or food they could easily carry away.

The villagers were largely unharmed if they simply got out of the way, but a few stopped to fight back and paid the price. Other local villages have asked for help, but in the meantime have started a network of lookouts to give the people even a little warning to flee for their lives.

157349.name: Starwhal
157349.description:
Play 2 to 4 player battles as neon space narwhals in 4 game modes in over 25 arenas or practice your abilities alone in the Obstacle or Target levels.

Source: User summary.

157350.name: Stack the States
157350.description:
Stack the States makes learning about the 50 states fun! Watch the states actually come to life in this colorful and dynamic game! As you learn state capitals, shapes, geographic locations and more, you can actually touch, move and drop the animated states anywhere on the screen. Carefully build a stack of states that reaches the checkered line to win each level.

Source: The Developer Website.

157351.name: Stack the Countries
157351.description:
Stack the Countries makes learning about the world fun! Watch the countries actually come to life in this colorful and dynamic game! As you learn country capitals, landmarks, geographic locations and more, you can actually touch, move and drop the animated countries anywhere on the screen. Carefully build a stack of countries that reaches the checkered line to win each level.

Source: The Developer Website.

157352.description:
Doom and Bloom SURVIVAL! is a board game for 2-4 players. It takes place in a post-pandemic world where there are few survivors. Your mission is to have your character accumulate supplies like food, fuel, weapons, and medical kits, as well as scout locations that may serve as a haven in which to start over.

You start off in once-peaceful center city, now controlled by raiders out to get what you have. There are plenty of resources out there, but you have to get to them and survive various encounters and attacks to reach towns that have potential as safe havens. You’ll have to plan your route to include spots that have the assets you’ll need to stockpile. Some of these spots are controlled by raiders, and you’ll have to survive attacks to gain the items you need.

Once you’ve scouted locations, you’ll have to return to center city for your family and more supplies. You then pick a location as your final destination. If you can get there with the required supplies and survivors before anyone else, you win the game.

The game dynamic revolves around the management of assets while you are traveling to your destinations. You'll be tempted to use them to gain an edge in an encounter, but you have to stockpile them to be able to win the game. Different gameplay styles and a unique route traveled in each game, coupled with game-changing Bonus cards, make Doom and Bloom SURVIVAL! a fun and challenging game. It is easy to learn but has multiple levels of complexity. Originally tailored to survival enthusiasts that wanted a real survival scenario (no zombies), gametesting has shown us that the game has appeal to all gamers.
157352.name: Doom and Bloom SURVIVAL!

157353.name: Lugnut Math City
157353.description:
User Summary

Lugnut Math City is an educational game in which the player controls a robot with a laser. The laser is used to fire upon the various blocks of each level, whereupon the block most often reveals a math problem to be solved. If the correct answer is selected, the block is eliminated.
Various other blocks exist, including power-ups, harder problems, and a level exit.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Winner
2014 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2014 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2014 Tric Trac d'Or
2014 Tric Trac Nominee
2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Grand Prix Winner
2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
2015 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2015 Lys Passioné Finalist
2015 Lys Passioné Winner
2015 SXSW Tabletop Game of the Year Nominee
157354.description:
Crossing into the Land of 1001 Nights, your caravan arrives at the fabled Sultanate of Naqala. The old sultan just died and control of Naqala is up for grabs! The oracles foretold of strangers who would maneuver the Five Tribes to gain influence over the legendary city-state. Will you fulfill the prophecy? Invoke the old Djinns and move the Tribes into position at the right time, and the Sultanate may become yours!

Designed by Bruno Cathala, Five Tribes builds on a long tradition of German-style games that feature wooden meeples. Here, in a unique twist on the now-standard "worker placement" genre, the game begins with the meeples already in place – and players must cleverly maneuver them over the villages, markets, oases, and sacred places tiles that make up Naqala. How, when, and where you dis-place these Five Tribes of Assassins, Elders, Builders, Merchants, and Viziers determine your victory or failure.

As befitting a Days of Wonder game, the rules are straightforward and easy to learn. But devising a winning strategy will take a more calculated approach than our standard fare. You need to carefully consider what moves can score you well and put your opponents at a disadvantage. You need to weigh many different pathways to victory, including the summoning of powerful Djinns that may help your cause as you attempt to control this legendary Sultanate.
157354.name: Five Tribes
boardgameexpansion: Five Tribes: The Artisans of Naqala
Five Tribes: The Thieves of Naqala
boardgamepodcastepisode: 3. Devon Dice Podcast Presents... a review of 2015 part 1

Year end round up

157355.name: The Currency of Hell
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157355.description:
from the cover:
An “Old-School” publication detailing those who broker deals with infernal or diabolic entities for the purpose of gaining dark power. Within you will find the new PC/NPC class “The Pact Maker” along with progression charts, new spells called Invocations, and the classes dreaded Eldritch Attack which can take many shapes and have various additional affects attached to them.

Compatible with most adventure games similar to the worlds most popular role-playing game.

The currency of Hell is souls. Spend yours wisely.

from the colophon:
This product uses the OSRIC™ System (Oldschool System Reference and Index Compilation™).

designer's comment:
While researching information on the mortal soul in role playing games, hoping to create an old-school warlock, I was able to throw together a lot of materials on the subject. This book is the result of that research. I hope you enjoy it!

An account regarding the journey of the soul in old-school role-playing games. From a possible creation myth to it's final heavenly, Abyssal, or Infernal Destination. Also introducing the Pact Maker. A new player class involved in making deals with diabolic and devilish entities in exchange for new spells called invocations and devastating eldritch power. Within are also several new devils and demons as well as help in determining a souls ultimate destination based on alignment and pantheon or deity worshiped.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157356.name: Player Character Record Sheets
157356.description:
from the Overview:
Perhaps the most comprehensive set of sheets for any player character in an OSRIC game. Each aspect of the game is grouped on seperate pages and formated as an A5 folder. A player can pick the sheets they need for race, class and equipment. It has sheets for spell books, diaries, magic items, notes and can be combined with "LLA003 - Mount and Pack Animal Sheets" and "LLA004 - Equipment Records" for truely intigrated [sic] equipment lists.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157357.name: NPC Record Sheets
157357.description:
from the Overview:
A comprehensive set of NPC Record Sheets for OSRIC. I have tried to map as many variants as posible to allow a GM to have the stats they need at hand.

The main page covers stats, character, combat, and appearance. The other pages detail class skills, spells, equipment and notes.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157358.name: Mount and Pack Animal Sheets
157358.description:
from the Overview:
A comprehensive set of Mount and Pack Animals Sheets for OSRIC. A must for any Ref or player, detailing horses, mules, camels, pegasi, etc.

Each page covers stats, combat, and equipment. A seperate sheet is provided for extra equipment.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157359.name: Extended Equipment Records
157359.description:
from the Overview:
Every adventurerer needs to have equipment. And so every character needs a list of thier equipment. This supplement contains a few examples of equipment lists, including backpacks, sacks and pouches.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157360.name: Misc Record Sheets
157360.description:
from the Overview:
A set of hex, quared and other pages to intigrate with the rest of Lore Lords forms and sheets. Also contains small, medium, large and extra large hex sheets without the Lore Lord title and ref.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157361.name: General Equipment Lists
157361.description:
from the A Few Notes on the Lists:
I have always liked equipping the characters I play, and dressing the dungeons and buildings that surround the players in my games. From my earliest times, spent hand copying equipment lists from fanzines, supplements and rulebooks, to the latest PDF age, I just plain enjoy a good wander through the lists. I am not an expert in weaponry, so arms are armour are not included, neither are items with magical properties and other special items, these will be covered in other supplements.

LLA006-General Equipment Lists is the culmination of decades of RPG, and re-enactment experience, and released under the Open Games Licence for everyone to use. It contains lists of the mundane items that make up a guide to price, weight and description.

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
157362.name: Character Record Examples
157362.description:
from the cover:
Each main character class is given an example printed front and back at high resolution for printing at any size. Also included is an extended example of a magic user.

from the Overview:
Lore Lords LLA series contains nearly 50 sheets for compiling character records. Both as examples and as an aid to our own gaming we present these examples of ready made character records. All the main classes are represented, and an expanded Magic User book is also included.

from Using the Sheets:
Each character record comes as a PDF file. Odd pages have the ref to the right, even pages to the left and are indexed with the LLA drawing number. I use my PDF reader to print them as a booklet at A5 size, but my players prefer A4 double sided.

This PDF has been left unlocked so copying of the sheets into your favorite editor should be easy.

157363.name: Salmon Migration Game
157363.description:
Players use dice to navigate around the board to the finish line. Along the way, Fact Cards or questions regarding the Salmon Life Cycle educate the players.

Targeted for children in Grades K-5, this game takes players through the salmon life cycle, from egg-laying to spawning. A fun way to learn salmon biology, including the dangers they face from natural predators, food supply, weather, and human influence.

157364.description:
Feed the Shoggoth is a fast and furious card game, in which players each control a different cult faction, facing a very angry and hungry Shoggoth in the middle of the table. To earn points and win the game, the players attempt to sacrifice Minions from their cult to the Shoggoth (bad news for Minions, but what do you expect when you join an evil cult?). However, the Shoggoth is indiscriminate in who it eats; if you can't feed the Shoggoth on your turn with a Minion, it eats you, and you're out of the game!

During your turn, if the Shoggoth is in front of you, you have the ability to sacrifice on Minion from your hand. The other Cult Leaders at the table can attempt to disrupt your sacrifice by casting spells to move the Shoggoth away from you, stealing Minions from your hand, or any one of many dastardly methods (Rival Cult Leaders are insidious that way).

If the active player is still able to keep the Shoggoth in front of them during their sacrifice phase, the Minion is gobbled up, the player earns a point token, the Shoggoth moves to the player to the left, and the active player draws back up to their hand limit.

The winner is either the first player to reach the victory point goal (determined how many players are participating), or the last player standing.

The theme of the game is based on the works of HP Lovecraft; those players who are familiar with either the stories of HPL and/or the Call of Cthulhu role-playing game will recognize many of the names and terms on the cards. However, this isn't yet another game with the name "Cthulhu" tacked on at the end (and in fact, Cthulhu himself never directly makes an appearance in the game). The theme has been interwoven into the game play itself.
157364.name: Feed the Shoggoth!

157365.name: History Maker Baseball: Century League Card Set
157365.description:
Expansion set of fictional players, umpires, and ballparks, based on 1940s era baseball, for History Maker Baseball.

The Century League Card Set contains 252 cards, enough for eight to ten teams. You can arrange the players any way you like, or you can use the numerical team assignments we've included on each card.

The set also gives you 32 different umpires and a set of eighteen different ball park cards, each with its own unique set of qualities.

157366.name: Kingdoms of Camelot: Battle for the North
157366.description:
Build the mightiest kingdom to rule Camelot! Join thousands of players as you build your kingdom in Kingdoms of Camelot: Battle for the North!

Drust mac Erp and his savage Picts have overrun Northern Britain. King Lot of Lothian is dead. His widowed queen, Morgause, appeals to her half-brother Arthur for help. It’s up to you to answer Arthur’s call and save the Kingdom!

- Play online with thousands of other players
- Forge diplomatic alliances with other kingdoms
- Train an army of swordsmen, archers & catapults
- Conquer enemies across the vast world map
- Plan strategy in real time with live chat

Source: The Developer Website.

157367.name: Race to Adventure: Strange Travels Rules
boardgameexpansion: Race to Adventure: The Spirit of the Century Exploration Game
157367.description: Race to Adventure: Strange Travels Rules is an official download from Evil Hat Games that provides rules and components for solitaire and 6 player play, 2 new variants, plus alternative board set-ups.

157368.name: The Hobbit: Kingdoms of Middle-Earth
157368.description:
Welcome to Middle-earth. The age-old feud between Elves and Dwarves rages as Goblins infest the Misty Mountains and monsters haunt Mirkwood Forest. The time has come to build your Empire and raise your army. Assemble your heroes and call forth your allies as you stand together to defend the realm of Middle-earth.

- Expand your Kingdom by building your keep, claiming your throne and growing your Empire.
- Build a Fellowship, as you connect with fellow players in real-time to build a powerful alliance.
- Gather a Great Army of Dwarves, Elves, and other powerful warriors.

Source: The Developer Website.

157369.name: Eene Meene
157369.description:
The title is more recognisable to English speakers as
"Eeny Meeny Miney Moe
Catch a ****** by his toe
If he wriggles, let him go
Eeny Meeny Miney Moe"

Card game. 32 cards in four sets of eight. Each set is in the same colour and is numbered from one to eight.

Four cards are dealt to each player and 4 are turned up in the middle of the table. The rest are placed in a stack to the side. Each turn a player may exchange one card from his hand with one from the middle. Or, he can take all four cards with his hand. After everyone has had a turn and nobody has exchanged a card, the four in the middle are replaced by four new cards.

The object is to collect together 4 cards of the same colour or four cards of any colours that have four numbers in consecutive order.

If you achieve either of the two objectives, you lay down your hand. All the other players now reveal their hands. For each card not in any order, they score one to three points. In effect, this means that they will score one to three points. After nine rounds of play, the player with the highest score, loses.

157370.name: Flames of Yesterday
157370.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was beautiful day in Curitzel until a shout emptied the small village. A single shape stumbled between the timber huts. Somehow, you seem to be the only ones who did not run away in terror. Perhaps you should have. The shout was of two simple words. FIRST ONE.

An adventure written for APLs 3, 5, 7, and 9 (character levels 3-10).

This adventure is a special, interactive adventure that can be available for free to any convention that requests it. If you run a convention and wish to run it, contact us!

157371.name: The Reservoir
157371.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 16 x 20 inch map of a Reservoir, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

This Product includes the VTT (Virtual Tabletop files) for online play.

“Water is life. If you control the water, you control survival, and you control life. And people will pay any price to live just one more day.”

The Reservoir is a single external view map of a facility holding water built in a rocky desert area that could be a different planet or someplace on earth.

The Reservoir is intended for use in modern games, post apocalyptic games, or near to far future science fiction games.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Hostile Takeover: In a post-apocalyptic future after global warming has flooded most of the world, causing most fresh water to be polluted with salt, and most desalination plants completed submerged in water, a businessman owns a water reservoir in the desert. He charges outrageous prices in food or goods for his precious water that he uses to pay for security around his facility.

The local populace is fed up after years of oppression. A resistance movement in town is gathering members trying to find people willing to risk their lives to put an end to the price gouging.

The Player Characters can get involved if they are part of the security force guarding the facility or if they are contacted by the resistance to help take over the facility. The Player Characters then either defend the facility or need to come up with a plan to attack the facility with the resistance or find a more indirect way of stealing the water from the reservoir than a direct assault on well-trained security guards.

157372.name: Wilderness
157372.description:
From publisher blurb:

Between the shining cities of the coast; between the villages and castles of the land; between the mines of the dwarves and the lairs of the trolls - there is Wilderness.

Every party of adventurers travels through wilderness at some point. The Wilderness geomorphic set from Heroic Maps contains 12 10x10 battlemaps that can be arranged in thousands of combinations to make unique and exciting wilderness maps.

Wilderness is a printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Wilderness is a geomorphic set, comprising 12 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. The set includes features such as rocky outcrops, marshy pools, copses of trees and moorland.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT, in both gridded and non-gridded versions. (n.b. gridless version only available as full jpeg).

157373.name: Sasquatch
157373.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Gather 'round the table and eat up! This Goblin Ration's made with some Cajun spices! Line up and get a healthy scoop of Pathfinder goodness with "Sasquatch" race in this Goblin Ration, our free micro PDFs!

157374.name: Collected Goblin Rations 2012-2014
157374.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Step up and grab a free copy of "Goblin Rations", our free micro PDFs!

Sample a healthy smattering of design goblin goodness.

We cleaned up and collected FOUR goblin rations from 2012-2014 in this document!

Included:

Knight (Cavalier Alternate)
Wolong (Eastern themed tactical warrior philosopher prestige class)
Lizardfolk Racial Guide (Lizardfolk racial stats and the saurian tyrant prestige class)
Chaos Mage and The Reds ("Reds" racial stats and the chaos mage prestige class)

157375.name: Futureborn
157375.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Gather 'round the table and eat up! This Goblin Ration's made with some Cajun spices! Line up and get a healthy scoop of Pathfinder goodness with "Futureborn" race in this Goblin Ration, our free micro PDFs!

157376.name: The Lard Golem
157376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody eats at our table!

Gather 'round the table and eat up! This Goblin Ration's made with some Cajun spices! Line up and get a healthy scoop of goodness with "The Lard Golem" a new enemy for the Pathfinder Roleplaying game.

157377.name: Bananas!
157377.description:
From publisher blurb:


Bananas!

Quite possibly the most important supplement of the entire year, Bananas! features a plethora of banana-themed options for your game. Including:

An all-new banana-themed race: The Nanamen!
The Bananamancer nanaman racial wizard archetype!
New Banana-themed options for your favorite classes!
Including the Banana subdomain and 4 new bananamal companions!
6 new feats to enhance your banana casting skills!
5 new banana-themed spells!
3 new non-banana-themed spells related to other banana-themed content!
1 new alchemical and 2 new wondrous items!
11 new banana monsters!
Including the pancake-crazed nannerpod and the diabolically delicious banana pudding!
Illustrations! It's got 'em!




What are you waiting for? Be the envy of your friends and loved ones, get your copy of Bananas! now, the only banana-based roleplaying supplement you'll ever need... Unless we release another banana-themed product, in which case you'll need that one too.

Yes, this is a real product.

User note: published on April 1, 2014

157378.name: Feats of an Adult Nature
157378.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warning! Adult Mature Content Ahead!

The title pretty much describes all you need to know about the OGL d20 supplement Modern Basics: Feats of an Adult Nature. It's a must-have game product if you want to add some texture to characters' love and sex life. The 14 feats contained in it are the perfect addition for a game with "mature themes." They are an absolute neceseity in this day and age where sex and sexual content is everywhere. More than ever before, sexuality is an element thqat must be present in games and stories if you want to taken seriously intellectually and be seen as socially relevant. You want to be taken seriously intellectually, don't you?

Although "adult content" has been present in many NUELOW Games products from our eariest days, Modern Basics: Feats of an Adult Nature is the first time we've dished up a concentrated dose of it. It's our bid to establish ourselves as Couragous and Serious Artists, with feats like Adventuresome, Gay, Gaydar, and Staying Power.

157379.name: Feats of Mysticism & Magic: A Flexible Magic System for OGL Games
157379.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic-wielding Warriors Without the Multi-classing!

Feats of Mysticism & Magic: A Flexible Magic System for OGL Games is a brief supplement that is compatible with most d20-based OGL systems. It divorces the spellcasting system classes, opening up more flexibility in character creation and advancement. It is designed with more mordern and futuristic settings in mind where the stereotypical wizard and cleric are the exceptions rather than the norm.

To make these rules even more fun for players, GMs should consider incorporating the modifications to level-based character progression featured in this free rules expansion, also from NUELOW Games.

157380.name: Feats of Seduction and Subterfuge
157380.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even the sweetest smile can cover a treacherous mind...

Modern Basics: Feats of Seduction and Subterfuge presents a collection of new feats designed to augment the effectiveness of characters who rely on charisma and guile to defeat their foes--characters who wield their personality the way a fighter wields his sword.

Although designed with modern or futuristic campaigns in mind, the material in this booklet is useful for just about any campaign setting and is compatible with all the most popular d20-based OGL game systems.

To make these rules even more fun for players, GMs should consider incorporating the modifications to level-based character progression featured in this free rules expansion, also from NUELOW Games.

157381.name: Good Cop, Bad Cop: Feats for Those Who Carry a Badge
157381.description:
From publisher blurb:

"He'll confess. Even if I have to beat it out of him."

Good Cop, Bad Cop: Feats for Those Who Carry a Badge is a collection of a dozen feats for OGL Modern (and other leading d20-based OGL systems) that are intended to give your cop characters some of that Clint Eastwood/Jason Statham/Chow Yun Fat swagger as roam the city streets busting bad guys (or maybe just busting their heads).

157382.name: Tools of Terror and Blood
157382.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's something lurking in the shadows...

As great as the OGL d20 systems are, few lend themselves well to horror; the game has to often be disregarded. With Tools of Terror and Blood, we hope to give GMs and players who want to bring the feeling of a supernatural thriller or a good slasher flick to the gaming table some game-mechanical support through 19 new feats and three new talent trees.

The lead designer on Modern Basics: Tools of Terror and Blood is Steve Miller, an RPG industry veteran who has contributed to dozens of supplements for horror-themed games, including ones for the Ravenloft setting from TSR/Arthaus and the classic Vampire: The Dark Ages and Werewolf: The Wilf West games from White Wolf.

Although designed with OGL Modern in mind, much of this supplement is easily adaptable to other games that use the OGL d20 system.

157383.name: Magicite
157383.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet. -Magicite is currently in early-access beta on Steam.





User Summary:Magicite is a RPG-like platformer that features randomly generated stages, crafting, tough game play and perma-death. The game can be played solo or cooperatively with up to 3 other players. As players level up they gain skills toward being a warrior, hunter, mage or any mix of the 3.

The game alternates between enemy stages, where players battle and collect various items, and friendly towns, where they can buy/sell as well as smelt metals into armor. At the end of each play-through players unlock additional races, skins and hats to alter their initial stats on future games.

157384.name: Overly Specific Condition Cards
157384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Conditions were introduced in the God Machine Chronicle as an exciting new part of the nWoD game system that encourage player agency in the storytelling. Many examples were included in that book, and in both Demon: The Descent and Blood and Smoke: The Strix Chronicle for Vampire: The Requiem.

Condition Cards have also been produced, in order to make it even easier for players and Storytellers to manage the Conditions in play at their table. Some amazing stories and themes are possible utilizing Conditions and they can provide deeply immersive and compelling moments of significance for your Chronicle.

At least, most of them can...

Included here are Conditions that are so particular, so specific to a very limited situation, so singular in their use, that in good conscience we just couldn't contaminate our Very Important game design with them. But, depending on your Chronicle, they also might be just what the moment requires.

Written by David Hill, the Conditions guy himself, and haphazardly and vaguely playtested, these Overly Specific Condition Cards include:

A Missing Tire and No Gas, and a Monster Chasing You
Broke a Mirror On Friday the 13th
Cornered by Things That Are Smaller Than You




And the ever-popular:

Don’t Have Any Clues but the Plot Needs to Move Forward

157385.name: The Game of Rat and Dragon
157385.description:
The Game of Rat and Dragon is a 2 player abstract strategy game played on a 6-by-6 square grid.

Each player has four Characters made of wooden cubes; a Rat (a single cube), a Dragon (3 cubes in an L shape) and two Soldiers (two cubes each).

At the start of the game each player builds a cube out of their Characters in the 2-by-2 squares marked on opposite corners of the board. Players then take turns moving their Characters on the board.

The aim of the game is to build a cube of Characters in the central 2-by-2 "Sun Square" or to capture one of the opponent's Characters.

Opposing characters can be captured, or trapped, by covering enough of their square faces with faces of your own characters.

157386.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – The Prize of the North
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
157386.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Every faction finds new tools to hatch intrigues and win battles in The Prize of the North, the fifth Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. New Bannerman characters open possibilities for multi-House decks, and fourteen out of twenty cards (three copies of each) in this expansion possess the new Prized keyword. Whether players man the Warships of House Greyjoy, march to the Wall with House Baratheon, or join another Great House, they'll find plenty of new paths to power.

157387.name: Nordic Larp
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
157387.description:
From the book:

In the Nordic countries, live-action role-playing has developed into a unique and powerful form of expression. Nordic larps range from entertaining flights of fancy to the exploration of the intimate, the collective and the political. This incredible tradition combines influences from theatre and performance art with gamer cultures, in order to push the boundaries of role-playing.

Nordic Larp presents a critical cross section of this vibrant culture through 30 outstanding larps, combining stories told by designers, players and researchers with hundreds of photographs of play and preparations. The editors Jaakko Stenros and Markus Montola are life-long role-players, as well as game researchers at the University of Tampere. They are authors of Pervasive Games: Theory and Design (2009) as well as the editors of Playground Worlds (2008) and Beyond Role and Play (2004).

Winner of The 2012 Diana Jones Award for Excellence in Gaming (http://www.dianajonesaward.org/the-2012-award/)

157388.name: The Basic Illusionist
157388.description:
from the Frequently Asked Questions:
This book is not what it might seem. First and foremost, this is a book of choices. Great pains have been taken to not create new rules, restrictions, or requirements. Adding this book to your current OSR game should not make it more complex or cause your Referee to develop many more headaches or involuntary tics than usual. Everything in this book can be ignored without peril.

announcement on The Piazza:
The Basic Illusionist, contains the illusionist class and one subclass (the mountebank), plus 24+ pages of spells (154 spells, actually), suggestions for running illusions, playing illusionists, and 3 illusion-related monsters.

157389.name: Plants
157389.description:
Plants is a board game that attempts to model the life of plants from their point of view in a specific, easily playable format. Plants is also a modular, organic game system that can grow and adapt beyond a single game board or a set of rules. The game is not meant to be an educational simulation, but more like an open creative project that deliberately intertwines certain biological concepts with suitable board game mechanisms.

During the game, the players continuously move through several different types of phases and perform actions at their own pace. They must try to adapt to the whims of the competing players and manipulate the upcoming situations to help them pollinate their flowers and gather enough nutrients and energy to produce seeds. At same time the players may sprout from the seeds, use the nutrients to grow in the habitat area and be forced to use up their energy to get rid of pesky larvae. Having enough water available is always a concern, and sometimes the players must accept losing their precious biomass. And if the players are not careful, they might even be eliminated from the game completely.

Plants features no randomness after a simple setup and there are no auctions, negotiations or trading. It has an open spatial element with shared resources and some three-dimensional play. The actions are short and the turns go by quickly and the possible butterfly effects keep situations tense. Clever planning and timing is required for success, and in the end only the number of seeds matter.

157390.name: Fast & Furious 6: The Game
videogamehonor: 2013 CVA Best Game on the Go Nominee
157390.description:
A mobile game, Fast & Furious 6: The Game, was developed by Exploding Barrel Games and published by studio Kabam. It was released on May 16, 2013, for iPhone, iPod touch, and iPad and an Android version. The story of Fast & Furious 6: The Game runs parallel to that of Fast & Furious 6, allowing players to race and customize vehicles alongside characters from the film.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fast & Furious 6", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

157391.name: Mind over Matter Book 2: Psychic Warrior, Aegis & Vitalist
157391.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mind Over Matter provides new psionics options including new archetypes, psionic powers, feats, and more for psionics-wielding characters.

The Bulwark Sovereign Aegis Archetype
Bulwark sovereigns focus their psionic prowess into creating the most potent protective gear that has ever been created. Bulwark sovereigns believe that their greatest contribution to their allies is to be the shield before the blow, protecting their allies from any incoming harm. With pure hearts and noble ideals, they rush to the forefront of battle or debate, placing the needs of those that they protect before their own. Rare indeed is the bulwark sovereign that fails to stand proud before the might of an enemy, be it on the field of battle or at the negotiating table.

Reverie Templar Psychic Warrior Archetype
The mind is a treacherous landscape within which to wage war, and the reverie templar knows this better than most. Inviting foes into their own minds, they can create the perfect conditions under which to combat their adversaries. It’s a dangerous tactic, but one that works to their advantage far more often than not. As they grow in strength, they learn how to project the imagined conditions of their minds out into the world to a limited extent, crafting reality to their whims to influence the tides of battle.

Verdant Metamorph Vitalist Archetype
Most vitalists use their powers to heal, but that is not the only function of their particular talents. There are others that are perfectly capable of changing their own bodies by the force of their own will rather than just repairing the damage caused by others. These verdant metamorphs are far more dangerous than they let on. They often masquerade as druids, keeping mostly to themselves and avoiding other psychics, but there are those that live the life of adventurers and keep company beyond themselves.

Vivere Vitalist Archetype
The vivere is a peculiar sort of being; full to overflowing with living energies that they are able to psychically manipulate in any number of ways. They often display over-the-top behaviors, whether those mannerisms are constructive in nature, or destructive. They are certainly vibrant characters that sometimes mesh very well with groups of adventurers, but some prefer to travel the world alone, living life to the fullest and beyond. Few are those that would come across one of the mysterious vivere and not know that they had met such an exuberant being. Standard vitalists and vitalists of other archetypes do not possess the ability to learn this method.

New Psionics Feats

Artful Opening: You are able to create a brief weakness that can make you look like an attractive target to your foes, then use that to your advantage.
Aware Within the Dream: It becomes very difficult to surprise you when you set the rules.
Controlled Burn: You are able to control some of the abundant life-force that dwells within you.
Gatesealer: While some others may prefer to bash doors and gates down to gain entry, there are others that prefer to prevent others from passing through them instead.
Ingenious Repartee: When fighting defensively, you are more adept than most.
Liberated Senses: Rare are the opponents that can get the drop on you.
Mettle Plating: When you create your astral forgeform, you are able to increase your defensive mastery.
Vibrant Pulse: You don’t just heal plants. You are also capable of healing animals and allies as well.




New Psionics Powers

Mind Thorns: You are able to fling a sharp psychic thorn from your forehead as a ranged touch attack that causes 1d3 points of damage.
Philosophical Excursion: You send your mind to another plane of existence (an Elemental Plane or some plane farther removed) in order to receive advice and information from powers there.




BONUS! Mythic Mayhem!
This product also includes BONUS CONTENT intended for mythic play. You will require Mythic Adventures to use this bonus material. Each future book in the Mind over Matter series is planned to contain additional bonus mythic material.

157392.name: The Summoner
157392.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Into the Breach" is a series of "crunch-focused" books intended to expand the options available to the base classes (alchemist, cavalier, gunslinger, inquisitor, magus, oracle, summoner, and witch).

For this first release we chose to focus on the Summoner- a class some consider controversial. Within this 26 page book you'll find 6 new archetypes, 4 new evolutions, 3 new base forms, 10 new spells, 3 new summoner friendly prestige classes and a new alternate base class.

157393.name: Fabrica de Software
157393.description:
Fabrica de Software is a game designed for IT Managers to simulate software development concepts. Also possible to see some Project management, Scrum, SOA, and other software development concepts.

In this game, each team will produce software. They need to have resources, programmers and time to make the desired software. Each software requires a certain amount of time, some resources, and programmers to be completed. Teams receive money according to software complexity. The team with the most money wins.

157394.name: Open Adventure (beta stage)
157394.description:
website blurb:
Open Adventure is a full-featured tabletop adventure game that offers out-of-box support for medieval fantasy and science-fiction expeditions. In Open Adventure, you play as a heroic or villainous figure free to explore the perilous world created by the all-mighty Game Master. Along your adventure you'll battle ferocious enemies, solve complex puzzles and navigate labyrinthine mazes, and much more!

If your character is smart enough and strong enough, they'll discover treasure and wealth beyond imagination! However, the journey will not be an easy one and is not for the faint of heart. Death will come easy to those who do not think.

Thus warned, shall ye enter?

from How You Can Help:
In Open Adventure, people such as yourself help design, develop and discuss the rules of the game in an effort to bring back the spirit of fantasy and science-fiction gaming from the 1970's and 1980's. Because Open Adventure is open source, anyone is free to download, change and share the rules. Even better, Open Adventure is a living game that is always evolving to newer, better ways of play while never forgetting it's roots. You can help shape OA's future by offering your ideas, home-made rules or artistic passions.

157395.description:
Aetherium is a skirmish level miniatures board game set in a cyber-mindscape where the world changes with the will of the players.

Enter the Aetherium - a world between worlds, a place capable of containing the human mind, a place of infinite possibility, a place that is no place at all.

Control the tyrannical and neo-fascist government of the Axiom, or fight for your freedom alongside the anarchist Nanomei.

Aetherium requires roughly one hour for a full game. Assemble your collective of hackers, agents, activists, or anarchists and lead them on a hyper-fast run through a dangerous virtual reality. Aetherium is a contest of mental skill, as players try to outthink their opponent using programs, resources, and the world itself in order to carve a space inside this fluid reality. Fight for control of the greatest discovery of human existence.
157395.name: Aetherium

157396.name: Pixel Legend of Zelda
157396.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of The Legend of Zelda.





I've been following the craziness of Ludem Dare for a while, and kept hoping some of my free time would line up with one. Well, it just so happened that last weekend there was a 48 hour mini-jam that coincided with a relatively calm weekend. I decided to jump in and see about cranking out a game. Due to some amazing weather I ended up spending about half the weekend outside doing yard work, and worked on this game when I needed a break from the weeds.The theme of the jam was "de-makes" which meant all the participants were invited to re-make a game of their choosing in a low-fidelity, low-tech or otherwise deconstructed format. After kicking the idea around in my head for a while, I decided to de-make the original Legend of Zelda. My de-make would be to rebuild the game, but with a viewport of just 16 x 16 pixels. No interpolation, no cheating, just 16 x 16 blocks of one color each.

To figure out if this crazy idea even made sense, I did some tests in photoshop to make sure the various pages of the world map would fit into the 16 x 16 limit. Fortunately the Zelda map screens are all a tile grid of 16 x 10 tiles. This fits nicely into my limit with a few pixels to spare for the status area at the top. The final content actually fits into a 16 x 14 pixel rectangle, so I beat my limit by 32 pixels!

Source: The Developer Website.

157397.name: Hippo Hunt Game
157397.description:
From the package:

Spill the critters
take your pick
find the hippo
Do it QUICK!

The game pieces are 24 plastic animals packaged in a plastic tube.

There are 2 ways to play the game.

- Dump all the animals onto a table. The first player to find the hippo wins.

- Put all the animals in a bag. The first player to find the hippo wins.

Another animal may be picked to vary the game.

157398.name: Contactics
157398.description:
Contactics is a business card with a set of rules which allow you to play an area control boardgame in which the components are other business cards.

Each player's stack of business cards is shuffled into a deck, and a hand of 6 is drawn. The list on the back of Contactics uses a sequence of four questions to define which effects your card has. Each turn a player plays a card, and its effect takes place.
The game ends when the board (3x3 grid) is full, and the player who conquered the most grid spaces wins.

It's meant to aid in networking.

157399.name: Pirate Ring
157399.description:
This unique strategy game is a challenge to master, placing you in the bid for a fleet of pirate ships. But pirates love only gold and easily switch sides. When the tide of battle turns, will you have enough ships to win?

Each game takes only minutes to play and engages you with different strategic options and level rewards. Pirate Ring has the timeless appeal of a classic boardgame. With tactics uncharted, you'd best be clever to defeat the Captain.

Features HD art and animation, Game Center support, and tournament scoring. The glory of the fleets can be yours, if you dare.

At the heart of this game is its puzzle board, a configuration of ships and rings and coins. When the game resets, the opening setups keep changing too, forcing you to change your strategy each time. Victory can come in different ways.

Just be careful because every move is critical and the game can be won or lost quickly. To play Pirate Ring well is to read the board for hidden advantages. Each small move has a ripple effect and unlocks new outcomes.

If you like the challenge of Chess or Sudoku but you can't find the time in your busy day, then this is the perfect puzzler for you.

Source: The Game Website.

157400.name: Experimental Technical Readout: Royal Fantasy
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
157400.description:
From the Introduction:

The 'Mechs and battle armor described in Experimental Technical Readout: Solaris Royal Fantasy Tournament provide players with a sampling of the custom designs that have arisen in the deadly gladiatorial arenas of Solaris VII's dueling circuit. In this case, the selection is focused entirely on the units and warriors taking part in a special mid-season exhibition games known as the 3146 Solaris VII Royal Fantasy Tournament.

The basic rules for using 'Mechs and battle armor in BattleTech game play can be found in Total Warfare, while the rules for their construction can be found in TechManual. However, the experimental nature of these designs also draws upon the advanced and experimental rules presented in Tactical Operations and the upcoming Interstellar Operations. For the benefit of players who concern themselves which such things, the data for all of the featured units identifies their lowest acceptable rules level (Tournament Legal, Advanced, or Experimental), but only as it applies to the Dark Age period of BattleTech history.

But this is no simple Technical Readout, either! In addition to data and background on nineteen unique units, plus Record Sheets to go with them, digital copies of the ten most popular dueling venues on Solaris VII are also provided. To go with this, an extensive rules section—covering not only the original arena rules as presented in 2004's Solaris VII Map Pack, but also updating each arena for the Dark Age setting! With additional special rules to cover the tactical abilities of all twelve competing teams taking part in this unprecedented event, and a guide to running the tournament itself from start to finish, this book offers players everything they need to finally answer the question that has spanned untold ages:

"Just who would win in a fight between Princess Jasmine and Snow White?"

157401.name: Tri-Logie
157401.description:
Abstract game.
There are 49 double-sided pieces on the board, each consisting of 2 pieces glued together. One color is up, the other one is down. The active player replaces one of the pieces with the 50th piece, trying to create a line of exactly three adjacent pieces of the same color. The other player contiunues with the replaced piece. The player who cannot create a correct line, loses the game.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
157403.description:
Pirates, merchants, and even the occasional captain of a Navy ship all seek glory and fortune on the Caribbean seas!

In the tactical card-driven board game Black Fleet, you're in command of three different types of ships: your merchant ship earns you doubloons by conveying goods from one port to another, your pirate ship by attacking and stealing goods from merchants and burying them on islands, and the Navy ships by sinking your opponents' pirate ships. With your (not-always-honestly-won) money, you'll improve your ships by buying advancement cards, giving you powerful additional abilities.

Outwit your opponents with fortune cards and combos, earn money faster than they do, and pay the ransom for the governor's daughter to win the game!
157403.name: Black Fleet
boardgamepodcastepisode: 29 Devon Dice podcast The Rising Xan,
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 014 – Dead of Winter vs Robinson Crusoe
Ep. 21 – Spiel des Jahres Trivia & Predictions | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 1: Troyes, Willow, and Warhammer Quest
Episode 5: Kemble’s Cascade, But Wait, There’s More! and Chalk Digital
Essen 2014 - Boydell & Bleasdale
Low Player Count - Ep. 6 - Mano a Mano: Co-op or Competitive
Low Player Count - Ep. 7 - The Good, The Bad, and the Dummy
MOBG 26 Roll for Galaxy 03-03-15
MOBG ep 25 Protect the XCOM Base
OOG - EP14 - Spyfall & Random Questions from Chris
Podcast #084 - Un programa muy chibi
Strange Assembly 161 - Unlimited
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 18!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 7 12/29/2014 - 1/4/2015

157404.name: Konfusion!
157404.description:
From the instruction sheet:

The object of Konfusion! is to "make it through the day." We've all had one of those days...sometimes they last a week! By moving logically and with planning, one can get through a simple day with ease...Right? Well...at least once in a while. But all days are not that simple -- as one trip around this board will show you. It will be your logic and luck that will get you through one of those KONFUSING days. The first player to reach the end of the day (the finish line space) may earn that coveted three (or five or 52) week vacation AND does win the game of Konfusion.

157405.name: Hodor's Guide to Hodoring
rpg: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying
157405.description:
Publisher blurb:

It came down to the wire, but we were just able to finish up the latest product for A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying: Hodor's Guide to Hodoring. We've been working on this for a long time and we think you're going to appreciate the usefulness and depth of this book. Best of all? It's free and you can download it now. Hodor!

user comment
this is an April Fool publication

157406.description:
LACORSA in now on Kickstarter, November 1 to December 1, 2016 https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1074108816/lacorsa-gran...

Race Your Friends In Style

LACORSA is a fast paced game based on the battle for position in Grand Prix racing. Beautifully thematic, it is a highly accessible pure strategy game for the entire family. LACORSA is now crowdfunding on Kickstarter.

LACORSA captures the beauty of speed, evoking the best era of Grand Prix racing. Bring your racing obsession home with this retro-styled strategy game that offers a high degree of flexibility and fun, using "pawns" inspired by '60s Grand Prix cars and custom cards that look like they're cut from vintage racing posters. The classic look is completed with premium components like the wooden game board featuring red and white beechwood inlays.

The art and culture that surrounds Grand Prix racing is the inspiration for this game. In Italian, "la corsa" simply means "the race.”

"It's tactical, it's a skirmish almost. You are muscling for position. Each car. Each time. Each play. Head to head.” - Forensic Gameology

Strategy At Speed

LACORSA is geared for both poker night with the guys and family game night with the kids, using simple rules, solid strategy, and an unprecedented flexibility for "house rules." The game easily scales from simple single-hand play to deeper strategy with multiple hands as a race team. Play it safe, or drive dangerously, risking disastrous wrecks with every lap. Championship points are awarded based on the finishing order after each race. The driver with the most points is crowned World Champion.
157406.name: LACORSA Grand Prix Game

157408.name: VTT Tokens Volume 01: Virtual Tabletop Tokens Fantasy
157408.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Hmm I swear I’ve seen these faces before, but something is different...And new faces have emerged from the crowd as well.”

This product is a Fantasy VTT token pack of 150+ 300 dpi .png top downs. Many of these top downs originally appeared in Top Down Armies Dwarfs V Goblins, Humans V Orcs, and Elves V Undead with a green hex base. DramaScape friends have asked for them with a transparent base to more seamlessly integrate into their onscreen VTT maps. DramaScape listens to our fans and have done so in this pack.

In addition to these remastered top downs, there are a lot of new top downs in this pack.
A gnome and halffolk were added for small heroes in an adventuring party.
DramaScape friends requested more female top downs; so four human females were added, including a redhead knight with a one-handed axe and a second brunette barbarian with a two-handed axe by fan request, and two longbow women. Other new human additions also include two new male wizards and two new male berserkers,
Two new troll topdowns were added with a one with a rocky and one with a dirty appearance.
Four new undead topdowns include two zombies, a vampire, and a winged skeleton.
An entirely new category of 27 monster top downs were also made, many based on models used for the figure flats in Fantasy Creatures. This category includes beetles, boars, Cyclops, devils, dinosaurs, elementals, floating eyes, giants, hyenas, slugs, spiders, toad men, and treants.




The VTT is organized via category Dwarfs, Elves, Gnome, Halffolk, Humans, Monsters, Orcs, Ratmen, Trolls and Undead.

157409.name: Bottlerocket
157409.description:
From publisher blurb:

BOTTLEROCKET!

Soaring onto the scene in a burst of sound and color, Bottlerocket is ready to battle the heroes in your campaign! Near invulnerable while rocketing through the sky, can they stop him before he completes his latest crime spree?

157410.name: Contract for Adventure
157410.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sign on the Dotted Line!

With Contract for Adventure you'll have the edge! Here you'll find optional rules for every class featured in the Labyrinth Lord core rules! From a fighter's weapons specialty, to a magic-user's ritual magic, to a halfling's nimble fingers - Contract for Adventure will give you the edge you need to survive!

157411.name: Traveler's Trinkets
157411.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Trappings of Travel

With Traveler's Trinkets you'll have over a dozen new magic items to aid you on the road and on stage! Whether you're wielding a Singing Sword in battle, or earning your money through the nefarious Cutpuse, you'll have the right tool for the job at hand!

While useful for any old-school fantasy role-playing game, Traveler's Trinkets has several items designed with the new Barrel Rider Games classes Bard, Tavern Singer, Greensinger, and War Chanter.

157412.name: Greensinger
157412.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sing to the Stars & Dance Among the Trees!

With the Greensinger, a new 10-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) you'll speak to the very essence of the earth! This elf-variant class combines druidic and bardic elements to create something entirely unique for your gaming table!

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
157413.description:
Set in the mid-1800s, the golden age of whaling, New Bedford gives you the chance to build the Massachusetts town of the same name into a thriving whaling community. Gather resources to add buildings with new actions and launch ships to go whaling. Go out longest for the best choice, but wait too long and the whales become harder to catch. And don't forget to pay your crew when ships return! Carefully balance time management and timing to earn the most points in this medium-weight worker placement and resource management game.

In more detail, over twelve rounds players take turns placing two workers per round, one at a time. The town board and whaling board contain basic game actions: taking goods (food, wood, brick), selling goods, building buildings, docking ships, and launching ships. These actions can be used multiple times per round, with the first player to do so in a round receiving a bonus or more goods or reducing the number of goods paid.

Most buildings add extra action spaces with new actions, combined actions, and more powerful versions of basic actions. You own whatever you build, with others needing to pay to use them and you earning points from them at game's end.

You need to pay to send ships whaling, choosing how far out to send them. At the end of the round, ships move closer to shore and whale tokens are drawn randomly. Ships that are farthest out have first chance to pick the valuable sperm whales, but as they move in, others have the opportunity to launch farther out and get a better pick, possibly leaving you with only empty seas. Over the course of the game, whales become more rare and empty seas more common. Once a ship reaches shore, a percentage of the profits (the "lay") must be paid in order to keep the whales selected.

After twelve rounds, all ships must return, and players total their points from buildings, whales, and extra money. High score wins.
157413.name: New Bedford
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep. 10 – Dice Hate Me Games & New Bedford | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 18: The One About New Bedford
Episode 30 - When All You Need is a Deck of Cards
GenCon 2015 - Greater Than Games & Dice Hate Me
Low Player Count - Ep. 10 - The Digital Mail Bag
PNPCAST 007: New Bedford & Nantucket
Podcast 46 – New Bedford
The Dice Section 30: New Bedford
The Dice Section 32: Bad Detectives
The Good The Board and The Jerks That Went to GenCon: Episode 78 “GenCon Reviews”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 35!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 36!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 37!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 38!!! With Ken Grazier and Paul Grogan!!

157414.name: San Fermo
157414.description:
The first of the N-SB (Small Battles) series is also the first dedicated to the Italian Risorgimento. Players can play both the phases of the battle or the entire battle with optional rules for better Austrian training and troop control.

Based on activation chits and operative orders, the game system is centered on the totally different battleground of Italian theatre that forced both armies to fight battles "hand to mouth" sending in company after company. Counters represent single companies, cavalry squadrons and half batteries.

157415.name: Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Issue 3 - Mar 2014)
157415.description:
Table of Contents
A Slaying in Smoke, 2
In Taruve: The Merchant Train, 8
Oh, The Beating Drum, 12
Swords Without Master, 14

157416.name: Brazilian Checkers
157416.description:
A member of the Checkers Family very popular in Brasil.

Brazilian Checkers or Draughts is played under the same basic rules that apply to International Checkers except that it is played on a smaller 8 x 8, or 64-square board with each player playing 12 pieces.

This variant is started by the player who either wins a random toss of a coin or the player who plays the light colored pieces. Then the players alternately make their moves thereafter.

Rules of the Game: This checkers variation is played using an 8 x 8, or 64 squares checker board of light and dark squares and each player has 12 pieces of contrasting colors, usually red and white. The board is placed between the two players in such a way that the double corner is on the right side and a dark colored square is on the left side of each player. The player places his pieces on the first three rows on his side of the board

The Moves of the Men: Checker players can only move their pieces forward one at a time on each empty square to the left or to the right. If a player successfully moves his pieces to the last, or "king row," then that piece must be crowned "king" by the opponent by placing a second checker on top of the crowned piece.

The Moves of the King: King pieces are "flying kings," which means that they can move over many empty squares on the diagonal lines that pass over the square on which they are located.

Captures: In Brazilian Checkers captures are mandatory. And, maximum captures are compulsory as well, which means that if a player has more than one way to capture the opposing pieces then he must choose that way that will result in the capture of the most number of pieces. If a checker piece reaches the king row while in a capture sequence, it must keep on capturing pieces backward for as long as there still pieces to capture. That capturing piece cannot be crowned king unless it finishes the move and stops on king row.

Captures by the Men: Men can capture by jumping forward or backward over a single piece that is located next to it only if the square located next to the captured piece is unoccupied. If the man can jump again from its landing square to make another capture, then it must do so because all captures are mandatory.

Captures by a King: A crowned piece can capture an opponent's piece forward and backward diagonally if it is on the same path where it is located and if the squares between them are unoccupied and that if the square immediately after the piece that will be captured is also unoccupied. The crowned piece can land on any empty square within the same path and if a continuous capture is possible, then the player must keep on capturing even if this move will not redound to the best interest of the player making the capture.

The Winning Player: A player wins the game if he has captured all of his opponent's pieces or successfully blocked his opponent's pieces such that the opponent is unable to move any of his pieces.

Conditions for a Draw: The players can mutually agree to a draw. A draw may also happen if the same position has occurred three times during the game, or if there are three crowned pieces playing against one and that both players have made 16 moves without attaining any promotion or making a capture.

Information from checkershistory.com

157417.name: Tales From The Crucible
157417.description:
From the introduction

Achtung! Cthulhu is packed full of heroes, but there are six individuals who have well and truly seized their moment; six drawn in to the chaos of the Secret War, whose very actions are instrumental in giving Section M, Majestic and the Allies a fighting chance against the insidious power of The Order of the Black Sun and Nachtwölfe. As the Third Reich’s war machine prepares to conquer the world and Cthulhu’s minions work to undermine all of humanity, these few inspire a host of other courageous souls to rise up in defiance!

The iconic heroes of Achtung! Cthulhu detailed herein—Professor Richard Deadman, Captain Eric “Badger” Harris, Ariane Dubois, Natalya Petrova and Corporal Akhee “The Eye” Singh—are the subject of many of the pictures, comments and short stories found throughout the books,games and miniatures. This dossier presents a more formal introduction to these notable characters. In 2014 we’ll be launching the official Secret War Campaign that will let you take these heroes (or those of your own invention) from their very human roots right through the most famous missions of Section M and Majestic, to a climatic finale in the Achtung! Cthulhu universe. The Secret War Campaign will also include new rules and suggestions for running truly epic adventures against the worst the Third Reich and Cthulhu can muster.

157418.name: Fate Codex (Vol 1, Issue 2 - Mar 2014)
rpgissuearticle: About The Fate Codex - Vol 1, Issue 2
Changing Skills: A Matter of Survival
157418.description: This issue includes articles on skills, on infiltration, and on culture, as well as a quickstart scenario.

157419.name: Wicked Words! (Vol 1, Issue 2 - Mar 2014)
rpgissue: Wicked Words! A Magazine For The Discriminating Gamer
rpgissuearticle: Play Dirty:  Kick in Your Heels
Secret: A Little Game About Magic
The Story Engine: A New Little Game
rpg: The Story Engine: A Little Storytelling Game
157419.description: This issue is comprised of the regular Play Dirty column, the new RPG System "Story Engine" by Jessica Kauspedas and John Wick, including "Secret" (a modern magic setting/ game based on that system); and the second chapter of Houses of the Blooded: Slumming.

157420.name: Age of Space
157420.description:
Age of Space is an economic space colonization "spaceship placement" game.

Age of Space continues the story of "Ryce: Empire of Sand". After exploiting the new energy resource "Ryce" on Mars, the manship is ready for the journey to the stars. You take the role of a space flight nation and your order is to colonize new planets.

The players build spaceships and use them to explore new planets and build colonies on them. Colonies produce raw materials or make further processing of goods (example: water and chemicals is processed to medicine). Goods can have different conditions (piece good, bulk goods, fluid goods). The player have to transport these goods from one colony to another or sell them to the market. There are different ships for the different kinds of goods.
